Unarmed players PANIC, are injured and forced to run away. Those lucky enough to have found protection are able to fight Otis with a dice roll. Better weapons mean higher value dice and a greater chance of success. Beat Otis and he disappears form the board until re-emerging from the woods on his next turn.

Be warned, as the body count rises, Otis gains strength, moves faster and becomes more deadly. Just when you think you're safe, you may find him waiting right in front of you!

If that's not bad enough, players must draw Cabin Cards which have a wide variety of game changing effects, both positive and negative. They contain Plot Twists, Cameos, weather changes, special Otis cards, clever Campers, helpful Weapons and Items, and fate tempting "foolin' around" cards.

The Counselors won't give up so easily. In addition to their own inherent talents, Survival Cards grant the players unique abilities and tactics to help elude or confront the killer.

Who, if anyone, will survive?
143096.name: Camp Grizzly
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 121: Mythos Tales, Far Space Foundry and Horror Films turned Board Game
Episode 5 - Camp Abeartoir Part 7: The Final Beginning
Episode 83- Salem and Daedalus Productions Contest

143097.name: Rock Bottom
143097.description:
Rock Bottom is game geared towards adult players who try to eliminate the other players by making them hit rock bottom. This is accomplished by playing cards on either the other player or yourself to either give or take assets. The objective is to make all other players lose all their money, their spouse,their children, their job and their home.

Rock Bottom features cards that fit players with a somewhat twisted sense of humor, as the cards that are played inspire trash talking the friends that you are playing with. Simple rules keep the game moving fast, and the laughs always following.

143098.name: Arabian Adventure
143098.description:
Publisher Advertisement

As Sinbad, the mightiest sailor in ancient Arabia, it is your mission to rescue Princess Jasmine from the clutches of Rex, the Wizard of Darkness. Your search takes you across the Seven Seas to the deadly Cyclops Mountain and you'll do battle with frightening skeletons, a one-eyed beast, a hairy tarantula and more monsters who try to thwart your noble pursuit.

143099.name: From Trash To Cash
143099.description:
An economic game with auctions, bidding, stock market cards, landfill sites cards, trading between players, takeovers at stock market, waste deposits so on.

Map of the game represents the big cities of the U.S. and EU. Each city has a huge garbage dump. Each player starts with a certain amount of money. During the game, each will try to buy at auctions as many landfills. The wastes, periodically obtained from these landfills are carried through the infrastructure which each player builds it. Each player must purchase their processing factories specialized in certain types of wastes. These processes the certain amount of waste and can also be upgraded. The prices of finished materials obtained from these factories are dictated by The Stock Exchange and by The Market (playing cards). Each player can also purchase shares at other players companies (directly from Stock Market or borrowing money to other players).

Profits must be invested in "Green Energy" (Solar Panel Plant, Wind Turbines, Bio Diesel Rafinery). For each such expensive investment, the player will receive "Green Points". After a fixed number of rounds the player who has the highest points is the winner.

143100.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Chronicles of Mystara
143100.description:
"Dungeons & Dragons: Tower of Doom and its sequel Dungeons & Dragons: Shadow over Mystara, the classic arcade beat-'em-up adaptations of Wizards of the Coast's pen-and-paper RPG are BACK, remastered and refined for the modern age. These games are returning with updated HD graphics and a wealth of other enhancements as a definitive double pack, titled Dungeons & Dragons: Chronicles of Mystara.

Just as in the arcades, up to four players will select their character class before doing battle against the mythical beasts from the Dungeons & Dragons universe with a mix of melee, ranged and magic attacks. But now, thanks to GGPO, there’s no need to stand in line for hours at the smoke-filled arcade, since Dungeons & Dragons: Chronicles of Mystara offers seamless drop-in/drop-out online gameplay. In addition to the classic arcade mode famous for its branching paths and multiple endings, players can utilize the all new 'House Rules' feature and customize gameplay for a completely different experience.

But wait--there's more. The Character Visualizer lets players track which characters they and their friends use most often and can help create a more balanced multiplayer dungeon party, or point out which characters are most under-used; with further gameplay stats tracked via a global leaderboard. Dungeons & Dragons: Chronicles of Mystara also includes a Challenge system that sets players in-game goals in return for level-ups and coins which can be spent in the Vault: a treasure trove of unlockables and gameplay loot. Finally, owners of the Wii U version will be able to use the GamePad touch screen to select spells and items with ease, allowing for a more streamlined gameplay experience."

Source: The Publisher Website.

143101.name: Alien Adventure
143101.description:
Publisher Advertisement

You are the sole survivor of a crew on a mission to deliver a cargo of oil to Earth. A crash landing has left you stranded on a small planet, harshly allen but rich in lead, gold and platinum. You must find provisions and a means of leaving the planet. But beware of the THING that massacred your crew!

143102.name: Tomb Of The Lich Queen (Savage Worlds)
143102.description:
[Taken from introductory text.]
On a legendary isle beyond time and space, a great evil waits. Made immortal through the consumption of living souls, the Lich Queen remains unconquered for untold ages. Fueled by the life force of an imprisoned angel, the portal to the Lich Queen’s domain can touch any world. It’s just a matter of time before the Queen’s hunger threatens all existence.

Your players’ heroes may be deliberate seekers of the Lich Queen’s realm hoping to reclaim lost knowledge or treasures, chosen champions who hear and heed the call of the tortured angel, or simply unsuspecting innocents who stumble through a portal. The pathways are myriad and ever-changing, but all lead to the Island of Paxectel, a pocket realm deep within the primordial Maelstrom.

Below the surface of the island, the heroes discover a vast tomb of shifting corridors and monstrous denizens. Imprisoned in a deathtrap with no clear avenue of escape, they uncover clues to a dark prophecy, an ancient cataclysm, a heartless betrayal, and a millennia long struggle between two immortals that has touched countless worlds. Assisted by clues from those who passed this way before and allies they find, the heroes are forced into a dangerous game against an insane artifact intent on corrupting and harvesting their souls and a final confrontation with an ancient mage who has had thousands of years to amass her power.

[Taken from a box inset in the introductory text.]
Dungeonlands is a massive, customizable adventure series set within the fantastic Suzerain universe. As such, you not only need a copy of Savage Worlds from Pinnacle Entertainment Group, but we recommend the Savage Suzerain book from Savage Mojo to make the most of it.

143103.name: Treasure Island Adventure
143103.description:
Publisher Advertisement

You are a hardy adventurer in search of fame, fortune, and whatever else you can get. You find yourself on an island where there is rumor of pirate's treasure. But watch out for the evil magician and the underground torture chamber! You may end up in a spot where all roads coming into it are paved with good intentions...

143104.name: Jack the Ripper Adventure
143104.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Jack the Ripper is running rampant in London and you must stop him! Scotland Yard demands that you take action, and the only answer is to set yourself up as a decoy. Be careful how you plan your costume, or dear Jack will laugh hysterically and leave you in the dust!

143105.description:
A free promotional demonstration version of 51st State. This mini-version is distributed free in Poland.

The world you know no longer exists. There is no government. No army. No civilization. The United States have collapsed. And now, thirty years after the war started, new powers finally try to take control over the ruined country, try to establish a new order, try to control others and create a new country, a new State: the 51st State.

In standard 51st State there are 110 cards and many tokens. In this free demo version, there are only 40 cards. The game is playable for two players and presents the mechanics of the full version.

In this version players control one of the two powers (New York or Mutants Union) and try to build their very own new country. Players put new locations into the game, they hire leaders, and send people to work in buildings to gain resources and new skills.

Every card can be put into play in three different ways. You can invade a location to gain many resources once, or you can sign a contract with this location to gain one resource every turn, or you can attach the location to your State so you can use its skill. One card, three possibilities. Lots of decisions and choices that matter.

Talia Demo 51. Stanu debuted in issue 25 of the Polish boardgame magazine Świat Gier Planszowych.
143105.name: Talia Demo 51. Stanu
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

143106.description:
from publishers website

Noble Blood is a game of vampire herd management and minion acquisition. Players take on the roles of vampire lords vying for control of their city. In order to win the game, players will compete to accrue the most bountiful herd of humans to feed on and create a team of vampire minions capable of earning you the power and influence you will need to come out on top.

Play centers around vampires taking turns drafting humans from a central 'City' area consisting of 6 or 8 cards. Once taken, humans become part of your herd and can be fed on (feeding on humans does not kill them) or turned into vampire minions(each card has a human side and a vampire side). Every action in the game requires the expenditure of blood, so it is important to have plenty of big humans to feed on. But it is also important to turn members of your herd into vampire minions that might have a good turn order, the right influence symbol, or a power that you need.

Each vampire gets its own turn and its own specific place in the turn order so every time a player makes a new vampire, he or she gets another turn every round. Each vampire is unique and most have some kind of special power that can be used to a players advantage.

At the end of the game players receive points for the number of vampires under their control, the amount of blood in their possession, and the amount of influence they have acquired.
143106.name: Noble Blood

143107.name: Crime Adventure
143107.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Test your skills as a detective, sifting through hundreds of clues. You may have to become the new Sherlock Holmes to solve this one! Look for the strange, but don't overlook tne obvious, as you try to find Mrs. Fenwick and return her to where she belongs.

143108.name: Around the World Adventure
143108.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Try to repeat the feat of the classic novel, complete with a balloon and other exciting features of the original adventure. Are you ready to take the challenge? Bon voyage!

143109.name: Black Hole Adventure
143109.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game represents an unlicensed use of elements of the Walt Disney Productions film The Black Hole.




In-Game Documentation

As captain of the interstellar craft Palomino, returning from a long journey, you find yourself face to face with a gigantic black hole. Moving closer, you find something more unique-a ship sitting on the vortex's edge, unaffected by the immense gravity. It is deep-space one, the Cygnus, humanity's most illustrious scientific undertaking.

Decades earlier, the Cygnus's designer and captain, Dr. Hans Reinhardt, conned the international space appropriations agency into funding this giant project. Then, after years of failure, the ship did not respond to a command to return to earth. The ship was assumed lost, and its crew presumed dead.

As the Palomino makes a pass over the vessel, the silent, dead apparition suddenly springs to life! Lights go on all over the Cygnus; her docking bay beckons to the smaller ship. The palomino lands, and you step into the legacy of a ship of robots, a ship controlled by its only human survivor, Dr. Hans Reinhardt.

Your mission is to escape from the Cygnus, and inform the world of your discovery!

143110.name: Windsloe Mansion Adventure
143110.description:
Publisher Advertisement

A famous prisoner lies in the dungeon of an old mansion. An underground passage connects the mansion with the Blair house, whose owners will help you to rescue the prisoner. Can you overcome the human and the supernatural creatures who inhabit Windsloe Mansion?

143111.name: Klondike Adventure
143111.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Snow, ice, and bitter cold surround you. Your search for fame and fortune in the northern country will lead you through many perils, but you may also see some familiar faces along the way. This breezy adventure will keep you occupied inside while the winter winds blow outdoors.

143112.name: James Brand Adventure
143112.description:
Publisher Advertisement

The President's life is in danger. As James Brand, you must save his life and destroy the evil Dr. Death. Your life is constantly on the line; each move you make could be your last. " Your assignment, Mr. Brand .... "

143113.name: Witches' Brew Adventure
143113.description:
Publisher Advertisement

You find yourself in an enchanted forest. You must find your way to the castle and rescue the Princess who is chained inside its dungeon. A tightly-woven blend of fantasy, horror, and science fiction, this complex adventure will challenge your wits and ingenuity.

143114.name: Titanic Adventure
143114.description:
Publisher Advertisement

You are the Captain of the Titanic on her maiden voyage. Suddenly a large white object comes into view through the window. Can you avoid the historic collision? If not, can you save the lives of your passengers and crew?

143115.name: Zombie Mall
143115.description:
Zombie Mall is a print & play survival game for 1-6 players set in a local shopping mall. In the basic included scenario, players are locked inside of the mall and searching for keys to unlock a door and a radio that will allow them to call for help and be rescued.

Zombie Mall can be played as a cooperative game, with all players working together toward the end goal of being rescued. Zombie Mall may also be played where it’s every man for himself (sometimes you have to sacrifice a friend to keep from becoming zombie food).

While searching the mall, players will come across Loot (random items & events) and will find Objectives (hopefully one of those keys that will unlock something important, but possibly something not helpful – such as a swarm of hiding zombies).

That mall map is constructed from Map Tiles which may be configured differently each time you play Zombie Mall. Sample layouts are shown in Sample Tile Layouts. The size of your mall directly affects the difficulty, as larger malls will take longer to search and increase the odds of running into hordes of hungry zombies.

One thing that makes Zombie Mall different from many other games in the zombie genre is that players aren’t forced to constantly scrounge for weapons. Basic combat takes into account that players are grabbing whatever is handy and using everything possible as a weapon. In addition, the players are not treated as ninja trained since childhood, so those randomly grabbed items are more than likely thrown or lodged into a zombie when used. There are weapons to be found, but the odds are good that a given weapon won’t be durable for more than a couple of uses.

143116.name: Arrow One Adventure
143116.description:
Publisher Advertisement

You are Adam Trent, a trouble-shooter for the Federation of Space. You descend to an alien planet and make a horrifying discovery, which impels you into a desperate and dangerous quest. This unique science fiction adventure will test your skills and ingenuity.

143117.name: Robin Hood Adventure
143117.description:
Publisher Advertisement

There are rich merchants to rob and great deeds to do. But have care, bold Robin! The sheriff of Nottingham longs to see thy neck in a noose. Thou wilt surely need all thy wit and cunning to succeed.

143118.name: The Mouse That Ate Chicago
143118.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Have you ever wanted to face the monsters in one of the classic Japanese horror films? We've got four man-eating mice for you, threatening to munch away on the city of Chicago. Each has its own specific weakness, and it's your civic duty to determine what it is and destroy them! Warning: Getting too close to a mouse can be very dangerous to your health - they love stepping on people.

143119.name: Magi Carta
143119.description:
(compiled from Introduction)

A Compendium of Magic & Spells for Heroes & Other Worlds

The Magi Carta is a compilation of OGL spells and the original spells from Heroes & Other Worlds -- nearly 600 total -- detailed to work with the HOW adventure game. Spells are provided in a comprehensive listing by IQ requirement, and in an alphabetical spell index at the end.

The book also includes new optional rules for learning spells, cartomancy, gems, staffs, spell books and familiars.

143120.name: Menagerie Adventure
143120.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Have you ever wondered what it is like to live in a zoo cage? Well, here's your big chance to find out. You find yourself aboard a strange spaceship, a huge floating zoo. You've been snatched from Earth and you're bound for who knows where. Escape is possible, but you will have to be clever. Don't take too long, though. You've seen the cage they are building for you and it is almost ready....

143121.name: Deadly Game Adventure
143121.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Well, your uncle Henry has passed on, and now you 're rich. But, first you have to attend the reading of the will. When you get there, you find that the will requires you and your five greedy cousins to spend a night in Henry's booby-trapped mansion and survive. You discover that one of the five is out to make sure that he is the only survivor. And the evening is just beginning...

143122.name: The Dalton Gang
143122.description:
Publisher Advertisement

This adventure takes place in the old west in the late 1800's, a west which is terrorized by the notorious outlaw gang, the Daltons. There were 4 of them: Emmett, Bob, Bill, and Grat. Your job, as sheriff, is to capture, jail, kill these boys. There are also other things you'll have to do in order to gain a perfect score, and above all, don't let the Daltons escape from jail.

143123.name: Alaskan Adventure
143123.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Brrrrr, it's cold. You're in Alaska, standing in the snow. Around you, fifteen treasures are hidden. Some are buried in the snow, others are cached in nearby igloos. Some are in even stranger places, and you will need considerable ingenuity to get them. Everything has a purpose, so use your imagination. And get moving. There's a nice, warm parka nearby, but you'll turn blue if you don't find it soon.

143124.name: Danger Is My Business
143124.description:
Publisher Advertisement

So, you think you're tough and clever, eh? We'll find out soon
enough. The American ambassador's daughter has been kidnapped
and is somewhere in the jungles of India. You have to
get her out. It may not sound too bad, but it's going to be
the hardest thing you ever tried.

143125.name: Adventure SuperDisk Number 1
143125.description:
User Summary

A compilation of three adventures from the Adventure of the Month series.

143126.name: Adventure SuperDisk Number 2
143126.description:
User Summary

A compilation of three adventures from the Adventure of the Month series.

143127.name: Adventure SuperDisk Number 3
143127.description:
User Summary

A compilation of three adventures from the Adventure of the Month series.

143128.name: Adventure SuperDisk Number 4
143128.description:
User Summary

A compilation of three adventures from the Adventure of the Month series.

143129.name: Adventure SuperDisk Number 5
143129.description:
User Summary

A compilation of three adventures from the Adventure of the Month series.

143130.name: Adventure SuperDisk Number 6
143130.description:
User Summary

A compilation of three adventures from the Adventure of the Month series.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
143131.description:
Constructo IN ENGLISH

Free app Android https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.dummysoft....

Constructo is an abstract strategy game of 15’ duration.
The goal in Constructo is to place one of your pieces on top of every tower while preventing the opponent from doing the same. The player with the largest amount of chips on top of the towers will be the champion.
At the beginning of the game, both players prepare the board (9 tiles) and get 3 kinds of chips.

Each player can perform 1 of these possible actions per turn:
• place a chip on an empty tile, or
• move a chip to an adjacent tile

The game ends when a player can neither move nor place any chip on their turn. The points are then tallied.

Winner of VI Edition of Granollers Festival 2013
Edition by Inventure Cloud © 2014


Constructo EN ESPAÑOL

App gratuita de Android https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.dummysoft....

Juego de estrategia de 15 minutos de duración, del autor Santiago Eximeno. Dos jugadores se enfrentan sobre el tablero para levantar torres. No importa quién participa en su construcción, sólo quién coloca la pieza más alta. El jugador que termine con más fichas arriba de las torres será el ganador.
Al inicio los jugadores preparan el tablero (9 losetas hexagonales) y reciben 3 tipos de fichas con las que deberán construir las torres.

Cada jugador puede realizar una de estas acciones por turno:
- Colocar una ficha de su color en una casilla vacía del tablero
- Mover una ficha de su color sobre otra ficha adyacente del jugador contrario respetando ciertas reglas.

Cuando un jugador no puede realizar ninguna acción el juego termina y se cuentan las torres puntuadas. Una partida se compone de 2 rondas consecutivas.

Ganador I Premio VI Festival de Granollers 2013
Edita Inventure Cloud © 2014
143131.name: Constructo
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ58: Constructo (2013) Santiago Eximeno

143132.name: Sternrupfen
boardgameversion: Otto Maier Ravensburg German First Edition
143132.description:
Children's memory game. Each child gets a dodecagon (12 sided shape) in their chosen colour. The 60 pieces represent rays that will emanate from the dodecagon.

Shuffle the pieces and spread them out. Now the players select a piece in their turn and if it is their colour, they may add it to one of the sides of their dodecagon. The first to finish their star with 12 correct rays, wins.

143133.name: Time Heroes Core Rules
143133.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the Kickstarter Page:

Time Heroes, in its default setting, is about stopping the evil sorceress Morgan la Fey from altering time as we know it.

Morgan la Fey has come to a point in history where magic has long since died but before technology has evolved to completely replace it (basically, the present). She has torn open rips in the fabric of space and time to draw through armies from the past and future with which she intends to make the Earth her own. She has managed to place a time bubble around a few year block that has been separated from the normal passage of time. Her goal is to take control of the planet, send people back and then drop the bubble, altering the course of history in one fell swoop.

The Great Merlini, last living descendent of Merlin has gone from simple stage magician to discovering the power of his ancestor within himself with the assistance of his ancestor’s book of magic, the Bionomipro. He is using this power to draw his own people through time and space in order to hold back la Fey's ambitions. While the bubble around the present allows la Fey to bring people through without repercussions, it also prevents going back to alter events that have already happened within the bubble itself. Essentially, if Merlini can keep Morgan la Fey at bay for a few years, the bubble will drop and normality will be restored.

So that's the basic lore behind the setting. But how do I see this play out in the game itself?

Time Heroes is meant to be a zany romp for a group of players. Ultimately, I envision it along the lines of a television show or cartoon where, though there may be arcs here and there, primarily each session is its own episode and - much like, Inspector Gadget, for example - Morgan la Fey will always barely slip away at the end of each "episode." Obviously the reasoning behind this is because if she's taken out completely, any series would be over. Also, she will be almost entirely in the background pulling strings and not in the thick of it herself. I want the world of Time Heroes to be one in which a sword-carrying barbarian, a laser mop-wielding space janitor and a Spam salesman are all equally likely as character concepts, even in one group.

143134.name: Metallic Guardian RPG
143134.description:
user summary

Metallic Guardian RPG is a Japanese language mecha Science Fiction role-playing game released in 2013.
Its setting is similar to Super Robot Wars, a Japanese tactical RPG video game .

143135.name: Three Dice Brick
143135.description:
Three Dice Brick is a very addictive high scoring dice game in which one or more players roll for points. The player with the highest score of 3,000+ points in the final round of play wins the game. Once a player has achieved a winning point total of 3,000+ points each other player has one last turn to score enough points to surpass that high-score. Otherwise, any roll of the dice which results in a Sudden Death scoring combination is an automatic loss unless the other player throws a Single 1 scoring combination to reset the game. Three Dice Brick is played similarly to Six Dice Farkle, Cee-Lo and Cosmic Wimpout with a few variations. It comes with custom designed three translucent glow-n-the dark dice in a small clear plastic bag, score sheet and comprehensive instruction manual.

Gambling Style:

As a gambling game Three Dice Brick can arouse a great deal of excitement if played for a small stake. Each one of the players must contribute a similar fee to the pot. The one who finishes first wins the pot. There is no second place money and/or prizes! For those interested in the bar/club version of Three Dice Brick™ it’s often played to determine a loser who must buy drinks for the other player(s), e.t.c.

Tournament Style:

Three Dice Brick™ tournaments can be held at house parties, local taverns, high school/college campuses, churches, clubs/bars, recreational facilities, civic centers, social networking sites, e.t.c. for whatever prize award individual Three Dice Brick™ clubs deem appropriate and winners can be awarded championship status or titles (i.e. Three Dice Brick King, Brick Master, Three Dice Brick Champion, e.t.c.). Three Dice Brick tournaments can be played by having players compete at several tables- with the winners at each table advancing to a final table for a Three Dice Brick head-to-head championship. The tournament feature of Three Dice Brick is especially entertaining for evening events at night since the dice are glow-n-the dark it makes for fun and competitive tournament play!

143136.name: Atmosfear: The Ultimate Conflict
143136.description:
Atmosfear: The Ultimate Conflict combines Atmosfear: The Harbingers with Atmosfear: The Soul Rangers, for the ultimate challenge. A VHS tape is used to time the game, but the timers have a greater challenge than time itself.

Your first challenge is to defeat the Gatekeeper, guardian of The Other Side, and host of "The Harbingers". He plays dirty, and plays to win. Players build the game board and race to choose their Harbinger and gain powers, and then fight to collect six keys which will allow them to face their greatest fear. Those who fail to become Harbingers in time will become Soul Rangers, who can only steal keys from other players.

After defeating the Gatekeeper, you can flip the reversible board over and meet your new host. The demented dentist, Dr Mastiff, leader of "The Soul Rangers". The Dr. now challenges you to lose all your keys and make your way back home. But the only way to lose your keys is to give them to the other Soul Rangers by duelling them.

Each game is complete within one hour, and no game is ever the same twice...

143137.name: The College Boat Race
143137.description:
"College Boat Race" shows the sport of rowing. The actual board is fixed to the inside box bottom. The walls of the box bottom are made of wood, covered with decorative paper. Components: four wooden "men" playing pieces and a cardboard spinner with a metal arrow. Game board shows a u-shaped track around an island with a boat house at the shore and a house on a hill, track surrounded by many types of boats and an island in the upper right corner;directions printed on the underside of the box cover.
Players spin a spinner and go around the track. You must finish the game by exact count in order to win.

143138.name: Advanced Blackjack
143138.description:
User Summary

A highly advanced program that helps you to practice betting, card counting and various kinds of difficult hands. Play a round of Blackjack and let the computer evaluate how well you play.

143139.name: Cogs, Cakes & Swordsticks
rpghonor: 2014 ENnie for Best Family Game - Nominee
143139.description:
from the Back Cover:
Cogs, Cakes and Swordsticks is a game of steampunk pulp adventure, designed to be played in the comfort of your favourite tea shop with your friends, and requiring nothing more than your imagination, a pen, napkins and a sugar cube (should a six-sided die not be readily forthcoming).
Inside you will find a nice, simple introductory guide to get you playing as quickly as possible (including a short adventure with its own pregenerated characters), as well as ever so slightly more detailed rules on how to create characters of your own, and how to run a full game of Cogs, Cakes and Swordsticks. Also contained within are details of the fantastical world in which the game takes place, and another, longer adventure, set against the backdrop of the British Museum.

So grab the cake of your choice and a piping hot cup of tea, settle down and allow us to welcome you to the Empire of Steam - an age of marvellous gizmos and mad inventors, Babbage Engines and flying steamships, dashing heroes and femme fatales, and the odd fiendish villian for good measure. In short: a time of exploration, intrigue and high adventure! We’re glad you could join us.

143140.name: Cogs, Cakes & Swordsticks Preview
143140.description:
Free preview offering background and basic system information.

Back Cover:
Cogs, Cakes and Swordsticks is a game of steampunk pulp adventure, designed to be played in the comfort of your favourite tea shop with your friends, and requiring nothing more than your imagination, a pen, napkins and a sugar cube (should a six-sided die not be readily forthcoming).
Inside you will find a nice, simple introductory guide to get you playing as quickly as possible (including a short adventure with its own pregenerated characters), as well as ever so slightly more detailed rules on how to create characters of your own, and how to run a full game of Cogs, Cakes and Swordsticks. Also contained within are details of the fantastical world in which the game takes place, and another, longer adventure, set against the backdrop of the British Museum.

So grab the cake of your choice and a piping hot cup of tea, settle down and allow us to welcome you to the Empire of Steam - an age of marvellous gizmos and mad inventors, Babbage Engines and flying steamships, dashing heroes and femme fatales, and the odd fiendish villian for good measure. In short: a time of exploration, intrigue and high adventure! We’re glad you could join us.

143141.name: Crux: The Pandemonium Scriptures, Volume 1
rpg: Dread: The First Book of Pandemonium
143141.description:
From the back of the cover:

Crux is an irregularly-published supplement for Dread: The First Book of Pandemonium. This 48-page magazine features gaming materials for players and GMs, written by (and for) the fans. Crux includes new spells, scenarios, campaign information, demons, NPCs, enemies, weapons, and vehicles.

CONTENTS:

· New rules, including Demonic Armor, Multiple Opponents, and Splash Damage
· Two settings: The Good, The Bad, and the Disciple and The Thin Black Line
· New demons like the Avomiad, Druthua, Gavisette, Ghaveaq, and Keilow
· Scenarios: A Cold Day In Hell, The Demon Bride, and Unnatural Selection
· Resources: Director's Cast, Implements of Destruction, and Spell Cards

143142.name: Swords & Wizardry GM Screen
143142.description:
User summary

This is a 4-panel GM screen showing


Attack tables
Turning the Undead
Base Movement Rate
Order of Combat
Indoor, Outdoor, Underground and City Movement
Saving Throw Categories
Saving Throw Table
Armor
Melee and Missile Weapons

143143.name: Number Jungle
143143.description: Number Jungle is an educational board game which increases the players' knowledge of math. The object of the game is for players to race around the board while encountering math problems along the way. Two to six players can play the game. The player to finish first is the winner but other players can continue until they finish.

143144.name: Tortenschlacht
143144.description:
A childrens reaction puzzle game modelled after the musical chairs game: The game contains puzzle pieces for 5 cakes, each consisting of 9 puzzle pieces numbered 1 to 8 (the 9th is the central piece without number). Also 5 dice and 4 wooden cake pieces. The puzzles are sorted. The wooden cake pieces are put into the middle of the table, but their number is one less than the number of players. The players each get a special die depicting five blank sides and one side with a cake. The players roll their dice simultaneously. When a cake is rolled the player yelles "cake". All players immediately stop rolling and grab a wooden cake piece from the middle of the table. Who was able to manage to grab a piece gets a puzzle piece of his/her choice. The player who is missing out on a cake does not get a puzzle piece. The first player to complete his/her puzzle wins.

From the box back: The dice roll and the cake fight begins. Everybody grabs quickly but not everybody gets a piece. Only good reaction gets a sweet reward. Who is the first to have a whole cake wins the game. Cake fight - the lightning fast reaction game.

143145.name: Hot War: Battle for Oil
boardgamepodcastepisode: GenCon 2013 - Zvezda
143145.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The year 1990, the planet Earth: The world is very much like our own recent past, but with no perestroika, no glasnost, no relaxation. American presidents continue to refer to the Soviet Union as the "evil empire", and the Cold War lingers on a thousand fronts throughout the world—from tiny tropical states to the headquarters of the intelligence agencies. Almost without warning, the next armed conflict erupts in the Arab East, at the center of the world's power depot. And this time, the fight is not only for how a small Persian Gulf country will live – as a socialist or capitalist state – but rather much more is at stake: control of the world's largest oil reserves!

Welcome to the world of The Hot War: Battle for Oil, a fascinating board game with miniatures based on Konstantin Krivenko's unique war gaming system Art of Tactic. This game puts you in command of modern troops and the powerful equipment of war in battles fought with state-of-the-art technology; it's also the first foray for the Art of Tactic system into a desert theater of operations, allowing players to explore any historical battle from the Africa campaign of Rommel to the Iraq War!

The Hot War: Battle for Oil starter set includes everything you need to create the first armed conflicts between the Soviet and American armies. Each side is represented by seven units: three motorized infantry platoons, two APCs, one tank, and one helicopter each. Motorized infantry units can be further customized and reinforced by machine guns, anti-tank missiles, and air defense systems. Before each battle, the commanders must choose where to position their reinforcements: Should you spread them out among your platoons, or attach everything together into one overstrengthed unit?

Like all Art of Tactic games, The Hot War: Battle for Oil uses specially-designed laminated cards for every unit. Each unique unit card displays all of the information a commander needs to use it in the field. The laminated coating allows players to write their orders directly on the unit card, easily cleaning them again before the next round. Players don't take turns, but instead simultaneously plot secret orders to their forces, then resolve them at the same time!

143146.description:
Suit Up is the game of friendly competition. A group of friends compete with each other to discover who is the best of them. To do so, they participate in a popularity contest over the next day. They will move around the city, gather influence with different social circles, and use that influence to invite their new friends to their home to prove their greatness.

In Suit Up, you will guide a person of your choosing along a new adventure. You could be the Athlete who has influence with the sports fans in the city and can move around faster than everyone else; or the Executive who knows how to garner favors and has many business acquaintances. Or you could choose one of the other archetypes, each double-sided, to give you a wide and diverse variety of options. Plan your moves carefully as the city is ever-changing and you'll need to gain influence with different social circles to gain the influence you need. Things will take a dramatic turn as morning changes to evening and the new friends you made will become more valuable than ever. You'll compete over a pool of available friends, so you'll need to carefully choose which people will be your new friends and when to make them. Your new friends, in turn, could help you gather more influence and with that crucial end-game score.

The goal of Suit Up is to have the highest Score at the end of 16 rounds (each the equivalent of an hour of the day). There are several things that add to your Score, namely:
1) Friends you made (individually)
2) Having a representative of all four areas of influence (Muscles, Brains, Suits and Cash)
3) Having the most Friends of an area of influence (amount varies according to setup)
4) Remaining Influence (at a low conversion-rate).
143146.name: Pick Smarter
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 25: Shiny!

143147.description:
(Note: This listing covers only the compilation versions of Saboteur that include both the base game and the expansion; for a listing of the expansion-only versions, go to Saboteur 2 (expansion-only editions).)

In Saboteur, each player takes on the role of a gold-digging dwarf or a saboteur who wants to hinder exploration of the gold mines — but each player knows only his own role, so the digging may or may not go as planned!

Each turn, a player either lays down a tunnel card to dig from the start card toward one of the goal cards (or potentially away, if a saboteur) or plays an action card to help or hinder someone. If the diggers manage to find the gold hidden under one of the goal cards, then the diggers share the loot found there; if the gold can't be reached before the deck runs out, the saboteurs profit instead. After three rounds, the player with the most gold wins.

This version of Saboteur includes the base game plus additional role cards (the boss, profiteers, geologists), new action cards (steal gold, change your role), and new tunnel cards featuring doors, ladders and bridges. What's more, the gold seekers can now be divided into teams — blue vs. green — and only those on the team that finds the gold score anything — assuming that anyone finds the gold at all, of course...
143147.name: Saboteur (compilation editions)

143148.description:
Description from the publisher:

Upgrade your game with the Zombie Dice Brain Case ... a stylish, noisy dice cup with a screw-on lid ringed with thirteen braaaaaaaiiiins. Brraaaiiiinnnnsssss!!!

Zombie Dice Brain Case – which is an accessory for Zombie Dice and not a standalone game – comes with one Zombie Dice Score Pad for easy brain counting.
143148.name: Zombie Dice Brain Case

143149.name: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing
videogameseries: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing
videogamehonor: 2013 Global Game Awards Best RPG of the Year Nominee
videogamecompilation: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing: Final Cut
143149.description:
The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing is an action-RPG focusing on the trials of young Van Helsing, son of the legendary monster hunter. Set in a universe that closely resembles a 19th-century Eastern Europe where magic and weird technology is real, the story follows Van Helsing teaming up with his father’s ancient foes, the classic monsters to defeat the reign of the mad scientists.

The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing is an action-RPG for PC and Xbox LIVE® Arcade and invites players to:

Enter a memorable gothic-noir universe filled with monsters, magic, and weird science.

Play through a refreshingly unique story, spiced up with wry humor, and snappy dialogue.

Fight fierce battles against supernatural foes with diverse skills and abilities.

Customize their characters through a detailed level-up system where they decide which skills and abilities they’ll need for the hunt.

Use the special abilities and tailor the skills of a very remarkable follower.

Modify their skills on the spot with a unique power-up system.

Learn the secrets of mystical alchemy and forge powerful items.

Build and develop their hideout and place traps to defend it from waves of terrible monsters.

Gather the members of the Resistance and decorate the hunter’s lair with valuable trophies.

Become the greatest monster slayer of all time while playing a cooperative multiplayer monster hunt up to four players.

Source: The Developer Website.

143150.name: Chi
143150.description:
Scroll down to Web Links to read the full rulebook!

Chi is a strategy game for 2-3 Players.
Each Player takes control of 5 Zodiacs, and must use their Chi to maneuver their pieces, and capture the opponent's Zodiacs.

On each Player's turn, they have 3 Chi (or 3 Action Points) to spend. A Player must spend all of their Chi, or they must pass their turn.

A Player has a variety of different choice they can take on their turn. For (1) Chi, they can move (1) Zodiac, or add a "Push" to one of their Zodiacs, they can also move the "Void" (1) space, or swap any of their adjacent Zodiacs.
Using this Chi, players will strive to complete the goal of the game: to capture all of their opponent's Zodiacs!

A Zodiac is captured when it is surrounded on all sides by opponent's Zodiacs, The Void, or any Void tokens.
Once all your opponents Zodiacs are captured, or your opponent forfeits, you win the game!

rpgitemversion: Soft Cover with three ring whole punches
143151.name: Book of All Spells
143151.description:
From the back of the book.

The Book of All Spells is a d20 System sourcebook that compiles together spells from more than two dozen different sources into one massive tome. Alphabetically arranged, and with complete spell lists by class and level, this is the book that you need on your shelf and next to your gaming table. Unless you like fervishly flipping through a pile of books trying to find that one spell.....

Inside

More than 1,700 spells!

Includes all of the spells from the core rules!

Includes spells from 21 popular d20 sources!

Alphabetized and indexed for easy reference!

A Wealth of Talent!
To create this book, we explored uncounted d20 universes, selecting the most exciting and useful spells created by the industry's top publishers. Inside this tome you'll find material from AEG, Bastion Press, Fast Forward Entertainment, Mongoose Publishing, Paradigm Concepts, Sword and Sorcery Studios, and Wizards of the Coasts! Clearly, this must-have book is a best of the best!

Can't Find That One Spell You're Looking For?
Face it, spells are an integral part of the game and dedicated spellcasters - clerics, sorcerers and wizards - are probably the most popular classes out there. They are also the most feared, especially at high levels. Spells are what makes these characters so powerful, but there are so many difference sources out there with so many different spells in them that it's almost impossible to keep track of them all.
No more!

Spells, Spells and More Spells!
The Book of All Spells doesn't give you any frills or thrills. No fluff or classes or special case rules to confuse you and your friends with. We've stripped away all the excess information and given you what you want: more than 1,700 different spells for all your favorite spellcasting characters. Spells for all classes and all levels. Spells for all occasions and purposes. Spells that will give you the edge over the competition...

The Perfect Reference!
The Book of All Spells pulls together the best and most useful sells from more than two dozen different sources into one single, handy reference. No longer do you have to spend hours looking through an entire bookshelf just to find that one spell that caught your eye. All are organized alphabetically for easy reference, while complete spell lists - including descriptions - let you pick out just which spell you're looking for. It's all here - the largest single reference for d20 spells. Every player and game master should have one!

143152.name: Infinite Crisis
videogamehonor: 2014 Global Game Awards Best MOBA Game of the Year Nominee
143152.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN BETA




This game is in Beta and has not been fully released yet.




User Summary

A MOBA game in the DC comics multiverse. Players select from different versions of some of DC's most iconic heroes and duke it out.

143153.name: Cyborg Wars
143153.description:
Publisher Advertisement - Spectrum Release

Not Another Toy

But a complex simulation of four military-industrial economies locked in a deadly struggle for survival. One to four players compete with each other and/or the computer. Balance of power depends upon Skill in developing resources. Use of espionage, exploitation of alliances, and utilization of military potential. Requires ZX81 or TS1000 with 16K RAM.

Publisher Advertisement - TRS-80 Release

Up to 4 players compete with each other and/or computer to achieve world peace. Balance of power fluctuates as players develop resources, use espionage, exploit allies, utilise military potential.

Tape cassette for TRS-80 16K Level II Model I.

143154.name: Space Battle (TRS-80)
143154.description:
Publisher's Catalog

Prog 80 and Softside said this is the best TREK based game that they've seen. High-speed graphics (Machine Language sub-routines). You are the commander of a small mercenary star-cruiser. You have hyperdrive or rockets (reaction drive) to maneuver with, missiles or laser cannon to fight with, shields for defense, a computer for information to aid you, and a loyal crew to keep everything running. You have been hired to destroy a fleet of alien invaders. If you survive, you will be rewarded handsomely; if you lose, you're dead.

Distributor's Advertisement

Assume the role of a Galactic Mercenary in defense of the Empire!!

Space Battles is one of the best space games we've seen in a long time. Features three levels of play, fast, machine language graphics, realtime input, and "smart" enemy ships that move and shoot! You'll find that playing the part of a mercenary isn't simple. It's not enough to eliminate the aliens; you must turn a profit, missiles are expensive, the rewards are small, and watch out for the radiation belts!!!

143155.description:
2000 point value army for the fifth playable faction for the AT-43 franchise.

Box Contents
• 1 unit of 4 Warmongers: basic super-soldiers
• 1 unit of 4 Sharpshooters: elite super-soldiers
• 1 Prowler: basic combat strider
• 1 Vandal: the most powerful Cog combat strider
• 3 heroes from the C-Naps line: C-Naps G09, C-Naps G36 and C-Naps G45
• 3 high walls
• 1 container
• Introductory Rules
• 1 Cog tactical manual
• 1 game poster
• 12 dice
• 1 “Cog” ruler
• 1 explosion template
• 8 game cards
143155.name: AT-43 Army Box: Cogs

143156.name: Banzai Zeppelin!
143156.description:
Objective: Be the fastest on a circumnavigation of the world
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game with following mdifications:
1 ending on a space with flags add or subtract additional spaces
2 you have to reach stopovers within a diven time (days); if you don't achieve it you're out
3 the earlier you reach a stopover the more you achieve bonus cards (waiting for the other players)
4 game ends at Friedrichshafen after all players arrived; player with most bonus cards wins

remarks:
published probably 1930

boardgamehonor: 2014 Origins Awards Best Historical Board Game Nominee
143157.description:
At 23:40 on April 14, 1912 in the North Atlantic, the R.M.S. Titanic strikes an iceberg. Water immediately floods into the liner's compartments and the ship is listing to starboard in a worrying way. There is no hope about the outcome. On board, there is widespread panic.

Alone, or co-operating with other crew members, you must show presence of mind and do the right thing to save as many passengers as possible. Time is short...

The card game SOS Titanic uses a mechanism similar to Patience, with the cards representing passengers who must be arranged on the decks, then placed in the lifeboats in a particular order. As one of the crew members, you and your teammates need to move and arrange these passengers as quickly as you can. Each section of the Titanic holds a pile of cards of which only the first is available.

On his turn, a player draws a few cards from the main deck and tries to move passengers out of the sinking ship onto the lifeboats. Failing to move at least one passenger or needing to reshuffle the main deck might cause one section of the ship to sink, thus reducing the number of piles available as well as the hopes of those still on board. Players can also use action cards to step in at fateful times when things otherwise seem lost. The game ends when the ship has sunk completely or when all remaining passengers have been saved.
143157.name: SOS Titanic
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 052 - S.O.S. Titanic
Episode 76-- Spiel des Jahres chat and What we have been playing With guests Joel Eddy and Paul Owen
Essen 2013 - Ludonaute
The Boardgame Review Room - Ludonaute SOS Titanic
The Spiel #185 - Mr. Suitcase
Vox Republica 112: Veni, Vedi, Vici

143158.name: Der blinde Passagier im Zeppelin
143158.description:
Objective: be the first getting all of the meeples in your home base on board of the Zeppelin
- acting by turns -
each player starts with 6 meeples, placed on her/his home base;
roll the die: if it shows a 1 - 5, place one of your meeples onto the correspondent waiting position; with a '6' it ends up with a safe seat in the cabin. Turn ends after a '6' or if all waiting positions are occupied; if not - it's up to the active player to roll the die again.But if a waiting position is occupied you must take that meeple and put it into your home base.
remarks:
published ~1920/30s
due to the fact that these kind of games were played for money players must 'bought into'; before the game started they had to draw a chip - top was neutral, reverse was yellow or (in one case) black. The lucky one (socalled fare dodger) got her/his stake back at the end of the game - no matter what position.

143159.name: Norway
143159.description:
This is an small game self-published by Yasushi Nakaguro.
This is an operational level wargame of the German campaign to conquer Norway in 1940.
The game has only 3 pages rulebook and each side has only 15 naval units. And game contiues 15 turns.
Naval movement is an area movement. Combat occured in the same area. Landing and air power are included but very abstracted.
The German player has 2 basic strategies, one is conquering Norway by landing force and the other is advancing one of his trade raider ship to the Atlantic. In both cases, the victory is finally decided by victory points. They are gained by conquering Norway or advancing trade raiders or eliminating enemy units.
The game has small map which are printed on the back side of the rulebook.
The game can be played within 1 hour.

143160.name: GODS: Intervention
143160.description:
GODS: Intervention is a fast strategic tile placement game set in the early years of human civilization. Players represent gods that influence the civilizations by granting them skills they may use to develop.

GODS does not use any board. It is played directly on any table. In each players turn they choose to pick and place one of the five different tiles available; a temple or one of the skills; Architecture, Conflict, Culture or Trade. Temples represent a headquarter for your devotees and may be placed anywhere on the table except in a civilization you already have a temple or next to another temple. Skills must be placed adjacent and orthogonal to another tile.

Placing a skill activates the surrounding and adjacent tiles. Choose between using their effects or to collect points.

Each game uses a set amount of each tile and as soon as one of the different tiles are run out the game ends. At that time the player with most points of the skill they have least of wins.

GODS is a brain burner. Players needs to be strategic while it is extremely difficult to predict the other players moves. A conflict may arise to destroy en entire civilization or through trade a civilization may loose much of its competence.

143161.name: Oppressive Heat
143161.description:
From publisher blurb:

Great Spirit of Oppression wants Tamagozushi, but there’s a Lord of Flame who has an interest too. The heat is on.

Oppressive Heat is a free "One Sheet" adventure for Savage Suzerain, a short adventure to give you a feel for the 1930s realm of American Grit where we set our Noir Knights book. You’ll want characters of Heroic rank to play this adventure.

143162.name: Heroes of the Tales
143162.description:
Subtitle: Combat-oriented character options for the Tales of Blades and Heroes RPG

Publisher's description:

Heroes of the Tales is a supplement for the Tales of Blades and Heroes fantasy roleplaying rules.

This book offers new advanced special rules for creating characters. These options focus on combat and action-oriented abilities, and can be used by players and GMs alike.


Create deadly fighters with new rules such as Axe Mastery, Sword Mastery, Flurry of Blows, Stunning Blow, Mace Mastery, and the Way of the Bow;



Master black-powder weapons with skills such as Deadshot, Marksman, Overloader, Opportunity Shot, and Rapid Reload;



Become a leader of men with Tactical Leader;



Learn new weapon skills, such as Man-Catcher, Bolas, Katana, Rapier, Quarterstaff, Throwing Knife, Maul, Gauntlet Sword, War Club, and Buckler;



Design a better unarmed combatant with new martial arts skills such as Brawling, Fisticuffs, Follow-Up Spin Kick, Haymaker Punch, and One-Two;



Mix a little magic into your combats with Dragonblood, Faithful Weapon, and Arrow Enchanting.


Heroes of The Tales includes:

over 60 new special rules;
five new monsters; and
an updated NPC creation summary.

143163.name: Evilot
143163.description:
Evilot is a defense game, where you play as Count Dolfus, a retired evil mastermind that just wants to spend his last days in peace. The problem is that the small retirement fund you’ve managed to amass, over decades of evildoing, is too tempting a prize for the heroes and adventurers running through the Kingdom of Evilot, so you’ll have prepare your defenses to withstand their fierce attack.

Source: The Developer Website.

143164.name: Grey Order Magic
143164.description:
From the publisher's website:
The wind of Ulgu settles like a fog across the land, clouding mens’ thoughts and concealing secrets from their view. The Illusionists of the Grey Order forge phantasms of shadowstuff to deceive their enemies. With their mastery of things seen and unseen, they are the trickiest and most difficult to predict of all the Orders.

Befuddle your foes with Grey Order Magic! This Print on Demand expansion for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay introduces fifteen Action cards and two powerful Item cards. Taint the mind of a nearby enemy, blast him with visions of his deepest fears, or simply mount your shadow steed and fly far above the fray. Grey Order Magic features new spells for all ranks for wizards of the Grey College!

Grey Order Magic includes:

15 Action Cards
2 Item Cards
3 Rules Cards

143165.name: Im weissen Rössl
143165.description:
Objective: be the first to reach your home base with all (4) meeples
- moving by turns -
'Pachisi' variant with following modifications
1 the number stepping out of the base and another die roll is the '1'
2 you can't be thrown out if your meeple rests on a 'bank'
3 you block all others if there a two meeples (same color) on the same space

A Spika (GDR) re-make / variant of Pachisi

143166.name: The Player's Workshop
143166.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The year is 1900, a dense new alloy called “Bloodore” has been discovered in the foothills of Georgia, enabling scientists to advance boiler capacities by a hundred-fold! The unlocked potential in steam technology lifts America into a new age of powerful gizmos, gadgets, vehicles …and war machines.

In order to spark a second Civil War, a power-hungry industrialist named Phillip Silverhorn has landed a gigantic Steam Fortress , dubbed the “Victory” on the opening ceremony of the World’s Columbian Exposition in Chicago. With the city laid to waste, America has been splintered into five new nations, thus beginning the Great Steam War!

Join the fight to overthrow Silverhorn and restore order to a war-torn United States. In Steamfortress Victory: The Player’s Workshop, you will find everything you need to create your Steampunk character! Choose from classes such as the daring Airship Privateers, the savage Dakota Braves, the high-tech Steam Soldiers, the mechanical Mad Hatters, or the electrically-charged Conductors.

So, strap on your goggles, check the gauges and get ready to immerse yourself in the world of Steamfortress Victory!

143167.name: Engineer's Manual
143167.description:
From the Introduction:
Steamfortress Victory: Engineer’s Manual (EM) is a guide used in conjunction with Steamfortress Victory: The Player’s Workshop (PW) to play a game of SFV. The Engineer’s Manual is specially designed for the unique individual who is creative enough to run a group of players through a game of SFV.

143168.name: Groove Heaven
143168.description:
"Get groovilicious and let the funk lead you in this exciting rhythmic adventure!

Rhymi must deliver a love letter to a beautiful angel, only she is a little demon and the letter is from the Devil lord himself. Climb with her to the top of the tower connecting the two realms and armed only with your best dancing moves! Time your steps right and keep to the beat to get moving and grooving away from oncoming danger! Dance under leaping frogs and past black crows as you collect musical notes and red roses for bonuses. In two bubbly and exciting modes challenge your musical senses either dancing your way to the top, or simply testing how fast you can keep up with the beat! Show off your rhythmic skills and tap your way to Heaven!

Features:

GET UP AND BOOGIE! Over 30 levels to complete in Story and Timed mode
MORE BONUSES! Red roses and pink musical notes to collect
DISCO TIME! Pick up the beat with the rare Golden Note
UNIQUELY GROOVY PUZZLE! You’ll be tapping your foot and humming the beat in no time!"




Source: The Publisher Website.

143169.name: A Day at the Fair
143169.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to an America in utter chaos, welcome to the world of Steamfortress Victory. Steamfortress Victory is an alternate history Role-Playing Game (RPG) set during the Industrial Revolution. This stand alone adventure is the prequel to core book Steamfortress Victory. In order to have a conflict for a storyline RPG, there needs to be a “powder keg”. This book is that powder keg!

143170.name: World of Steamfortress Victory
143170.description:
Publisher Blurb:
This is the book you have all been waiting for!

The Steamfortress Victory alternate history universe is on the verge of marking its third anniversary of publication. And let me tell you, we have been on a long journey since 2010...

This latest book, World of Steamfortress Victory, marks a major turning point for the game. For three years, we have been building up the tone of the Five Nations and giving you a taste of the pre-history that led up to the destruction of the United States of America. We have given you a rich background to work with, setting up a clockwork world on the very edge of Total War. Well, guess what?

Total War is about to begin!

After this book, we are advancing Steamfortress Victory’s story arc into the years following the New Century Truce of 1900. The Truce was established to give each of the Five Nations a cease fire, which would allow a slight economic recovery from the Great Steam War. The world has stabilized since the Truce was signed, but the agreement only was to last one year. No one in the Five Nations is really sure what happens on New Year’s Day 1901, but it likely that tensions will flare up again as the feud between the Unified States and the Confederation of Free States was never truly resolved. We are now onto chronicling the years between 1901 and 1905, which bring about new strife in the Five Nations. This brings about a period of history we are calling the Timewelder Schism, where the final fate of the colossal steam fortress named Victory will be decided.

So, where does this book fit into the Timewelder Schism?

The World of Steamfortress Victory is more of a primer for the Timewelder Schism story arc than an actual role-playing game sourcebook. It gives you background on all of the main characters of the Timewelder Schism and explains the settings and societies that they operate in. There are still statistics and mechanics for use in the role-playing game, but this book is where Steamfortress Victory makes its transition from a ‘Steampunk Role-Playing Game’ to a running ‘Science Fiction Serial’. There will still be several short-format adventures and updated rule sets published for Steamfortress Victory, but we are going put a great deal of focus on telling the story of Silverhorn, Hawkings, and the Victory for the near future. In short, when Josh, Matt, Tyler, and I started this whole thing in 2010, we had a story to tell...

And in the next coming years, we are going to complete the tale!

143171.name: Tales of the North: The Raiding Party (Labyrinth Lord)
143171.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Raiding Party is a Labyrinth Lord compatible module published by Black Wyvern Press for 4 to 6 1st to 3rd level characters.

The borderland has for over a thousand years marked the northernmost progress of human civilization. The border is not a line marked on a map but a tide advancing and receding. The Borderland is the tidal plane between high and low tide claimed by both wilderness and civilization but held for long by neither.

143172.name: Polarity: where there is no middle ground.
rpg: Polarity: where there is no middle ground.
143172.description:
Designer Blurb:

Polarity is a 2013 Game Chef contest entry. As part of the contest the game had to follow a specific theme and use at least two special ingredients. For 2013 these ingredients are all black and white icons.

From the introduction:

The world is dark; the lights went out years ago. Why did it go dark? No one really knows and no one really cares. All that matters is that when the light left they came. There wasn't time to wonder why at that point. There wasn't time for anything except the fighting to survive.

Where did they come from? They came from within. They were there inside the good and pure things, just waiting for the lights to go out. The came from within and when they came they corrupted. The corrupted the flesh of the host and then spread to others. Like one rotten apple in a bunch the corruption spread and it continues to spread.

The corruption didn't get all of us though. Some of us still wear the mantle of humanity. Under the cloak of darkness we fight back. Those who survived the corruption within gained strength from it. Strength of the mind. Some call it mental power, psychic abilities or even magic. Most just call it power. Power to fight back. Power to beat them. Power to re-light the darkness. Welcome to the world of Polarity. This is a game of black and white, a game of sides where the light fights against the darkness. It’s a game of Us vs. Them.

From the Themes of Polarity:

Polarity is designed to be a GM driven RPG where the GM will frame scenes for the player or players. The game works just as well with just one player and a GM as it does with multiple players. The GM creates scenes and every scene should include some form of conflict. The conflict resolution system is an opposed die roll system. The system uses 2d6 and when a player rolls they have to choose one die to be UP which helps your total and one die to be DOWN which hinders your opposition. There are both simple single roll mundane conflicts and multiple roll epic conflicts. One thing that may different from other RPGs you know is that Player vs. Player conflict is a valid and possible option, though it the players choice on whether to include it or not.

143173.name: Naruto Powerful Shippuden
143173.description:
"JOIN NARUTO & ROCK LEE IN TWO FUN ADVENTURES!

A whole new side-scrolling NARUTO game developed exclusively for the Nintendo 3DS™ focused on cutesy presentation, comical character style and easy to pick-up-and-play gameplay for fans of all ages.

Features:

Two different stories - Play as either Naruto or Rock Lee and enjoy missions taken directly from their animated storylines
Two different gameplay modes - Story Mode & Endless Battle mode included
Anime inspired presentation - Comical graphics with humorous on-screen expressions and actions
Action-packed gameplay - Earn experience points to power up your characters, call-in support characters during battles or use the touch screen to strengthen special attacks
QR code feature - Scan special QR codes designed for the game and gain access to other bonuses"




Source: The Publisher Website.

143174.name: Game of Gliding
143174.description:
Directions are on inside of top cover. The game board is the inside bottom of the bottom box. Components: spinner dial and four wood colored player pieces.

Players spin the spinner and move their pieces (gliders). The object of the game to keep gliders in the air. The last player who stay in the air wins the game.

143175.description:
In Kashgar: Händler der Seidenstraße, the players trade different spices that are coming over the silk road from Asia to Europe. Each player has control over three caravans. In the beginning, each caravan consists of three cards that are spread out vertically so that the top part of each card is visible; each card stands for a caravan member with different abilities.

On his turn, a player performs only one action, choosing one of the cards on top of the three families and executing one action shown on that card. Then the card is put at the back of its caravan. To use the same caravan member again, a player must first use all the other cards on top of that caravan row.

These actions can influence the player's stock of spice, gold and mules. To keep track of that stock, each player has his own board with wooden markers that are moved accordingly. Actions can also bring new members to the caravans and can enable the player to fulfill one of four delivery request cards from the middle of the table. Finally, there are actions that mix things up a bit, such as by getting rid of a caravan member or even influencing other players' caravans.

The game ends when one player has earned 25 points by collecting character cards and fulfilling delivery request cards.

The core mechanism of Kashgar could be called "open deck-building". The game plays quickly with little downtime. After having learned the different actions of the cards, players can start trying out different strategies and combinations of caravan members, caravan sizes, etc.
143175.name: Kashgar: Händler der Seidenstraße
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 73 -- The Chicago Manual of Voting
Garrett's Games 390 - Glass Road and Kashgar
Kashgar - Händler der Seidenstraße (Kosmos): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 203

143176.description:
Inventors and tinkerers abound in the Victorian era, harnessing the power of clockwork, steam, and electricks to build machines capable of anything to give glory to Queen Victoria!

In the steampunk worker placement game Steam Works, you'll put your mechanics to work collecting components and power sources, then you'll literally build devices by assembling those sources and components. What's more, those devices in turn become action spaces for other players to use!

Each player takes on an inventor persona with unique starting components or special abilities accessible only to themselves. But the heart of the game is in assembling modular component tiles into a device for other players to use. Sources may provide one or more of the three power types — clockwork, steam, or Tesla-style electrickal power — to the components connected to them, which in turn provide a wide range of effects for gaining resources, prestige points, or more component tiles. Devices start simple with just two components (one source and one component), but devices with three, four or more components will become possible — as soon as the players assemble a device to let it be possible. Because of the modular mix-and-match nature of the components, the available action spaces vary widely from one game to the next, providing great replayability: each game players will create devices never seen before!
143176.name: Steam Works
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 10 - Eminent Domain Review
Episode 20: Rattle Battle Grab the Loot and Steam Works
Episode 21: Steam Works And Duel Lists
Episode 43 - Shadows Over Normandie
Episode 44 – Reviewapalooza Gold West, Steam Works & Star Wars: Force and Destiny Beginner Game
Episode 53- Elysium and GenCon 2015 Preview
Episode 56- Rattle, Battle, Grab the Loot and Gaming Relationships

143177.name: Game of Parachute Jump
143177.description:
Directions are on inside of top cover. The game board is the inside bottom of the bottom box. Components: spinner dial and four wood colored player pieces.

Players spins the spinner and moves they pieces. The object of the game to obtain the highest number of points in going aloft four times and make as many drops with a parachute.

143178.name: Core Mechanix
143178.description:
From publisher blurb:

The year is 1900 and the Century Truce between the Five Nations is on the verge of collapse. The end of the cease fire would spell total war in Industrial America. Finally, Phillip Silverhorn and his steam fortress, the Victory, will make blood rain from the skies as he puts his jackboot on the throat of the other nations. Join the Five Nations' struggle to overcome oppression with Steamfortress Victory: Core Mechanix. It will guide you through the basics of character generation, explain the basic concepts of the SFV world, and provide you with a revised rule set from The Player's Workshop.

143179.name: A Steampunk Christmas Carol
143179.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Twas the Night Before Christmas and Rex was drunk as hell,
His vision was blurring, he wasn’t feeling too well,
Chief Sonny and friends helped him, they did what they could,
But the Timberwolves ambushed, stranded'um where they stood,
Now, it’s Christmas, and the New Money is stuck in the casino from Hell,
Play out the Steampunk Christmas Carol, and hope it all goes well!

This is a special Holiday adventure for the Steamfortress Victory game system. Pick up our Holiday Package on available on Black Friday and play with all of the SFV Pre-1901 material! Cause when New Years rolls around, we are gonna' party like it's 1902!

143180.name: Game of Black Cat
143180.description:
From McLoughlin & Sons 1885

"Game of Black Cat" card game with 53 playing cards, two counters and an instruction booklet in a paper covered cardboard box; playing cards have printed images of cat parts such as whiskers, hind paws, eyes etc. on one side; box cover lithographed with the image of a black cat's head;

143181.name: Shin Megami Tensei IV
videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Nintendo Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Story of the Year Nominee
2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Villain of the Year Winner
2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Guy of the Year Nominee
143181.description:
"Shin Megami Tensei IV (真・女神転生IV) is a 2013 title in the Megami Tensei role-playing series of video games.

Atlus was confirmed to be developing a new title for the Nintendo 3DS at Nintendo's E3 2010 press conference. The game was officially announced on a two-page spread in Famitsu Magazine as a title for the Nintendo handheld.

The first trailer for the game was included with the Japanese 3DS release of Devil Summoner: Soul Hackers on August 30, 2012. A second trailer was released on September 17, 2012, with an extended version shown at the Tokyo Game Show and later released to the public.

The game is the first in the main series to have full voice acting."

Source: Wikipedia, "Shin Megami Tensei IV", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

143182.name: Tamagotchi no Doki Doki Dream Omisecchi
143182.description:
User Summary
Tamagotchi no Doki Doki Dream Omisecchi is a virtual life simulation game featuring Tamagotchi characters.

143184.name: Floor Games
143184.description:
The first published miniatures wargaming rules of the 20th century. A rulebook on miniatures and other props for playing children's games. A companion to the designer's later title Little Wars. Floor Games is a crude miniatures and RPG hybrid. Creating the gameplay area is large part of the gaming experience as designer Wells explains "...the setting-out ... is half the game." While specs and dimensions for setup are given, many of the details like combat resolutions are left for the children to make up on the fly.

Floor Games has rules for two games and suggestions for four minor games. The designer gives dimensions and parameters for setting up The Game Of The Wonderful Islands and Of The Building Of Cities. While "...glance ... shortly at some other ... uses of the floor..." means that Wells briefly suggest ideas for four minor games: Funiculars, Marble Towers, Castles And War Games, and But Very Little Of War Games.

The Game Of The Wonderful Islands -- play two competing explorers, Captain G. P. W and Captain F. R. W of settling tribal islands that are modeled after Greek civilization.

Of The Building Of Cities -- play as rulers of the fictional twin, modern cities, like London and Westminster. A crude city management simulation game.

Expanded by Little Wars

boardgameintegration: Smash Up: Pretty Pretty Smash Up
Smash Up: Science Fiction Double Feature
Smash Up: What Were We Thinking?
Smash Up: Pretty Pretty Smash Up
Smash Up: Science Fiction Double Feature
Smash Up: What Were We Thinking?
143185.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Just when you thought Smash Up might escape, the International Gaming Authority reminded us at AEG that we were honor-bound to include Cthulhu in one of our products, so we set on to make the most Cthulhu-est product ever.

Smash Up: The Obligatory Cthulhu Set features crazy Cthulhu cultists, fishy Innsmouth locals, horrifying Elder Things, and good old Miskatonic University members (the Fightin' Cephalopods). To be certain we got it right, this set also includes a new card type fittingly known as "Madness" that each of these groups can use to various effects. Just remember that Madness brings you power but at a price (joking!).

If you're ready to embrace the creatures beyond the understanding of mortal men, then shuffle up these guys with your pirates, bear cavalry, and others for the most awesome fit of crazed insanity you've had in a long time!
143185.name: Smash Up: The Obligatory Cthulhu Set
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 11: Keyflower/Pink Peg Christina Hot Seat
Episode 23 - Two Interviews, One Podcast
MN 0077 Smash Up
The Boardgame Review Room: Smash Up!

143186.name: Double Sens 3
143186.description:
135 pictures are on the table. The clue you are given matches none of the pictres... Two pictures has a word sounding like the clue word you are looking for... And that's the answer!
So think quickly and find the two matching pictures before everyone else!

The goal of the game is to name the word by pointing two pictures. To win a point you must be the first to point the good pictures.

143187.name: Double Sens 4
143187.description:
100 pictures are on the table. The clue you are given matches none of the pictres... Two pictures has a word sounding like the clue word you are looking for... And that's the answer!
So think quickly and find the two matching pictures before everyone else!

The goal of the game is to name the word by pointing two pictures. To win a point you must be the first to point the good pictures.

143188.name: Vengeance from the Grave
143188.description:
Publisher's description:

Vengeance From The Grave is a Tales of Blades and Heroes adventure taking place in an underground necropolis. As the characters explore old tombs and discover a villainous act that went unpunished 100 years before, what begun as a dungeon crawl turns into a revenge story.

Vengeance From The Grave includes full game stats for new monsters, magic items and ready-to-run NPCs. It can be easily inserted into any high-fantasy campaign. It has enough material for 5-6 play sessions.
