Suitable for 3 to 6 heroes, each built on 50 to 60 points.

143189.name: Snaaaake!
143189.description:
Play free online game Snaaaaake! from Adult Swim Games. You’re a giant serpent with destructive tendencies. Flatten everything in your path, eat whatever’s left over, then tune in and watch yourself on the evening news.
Instructions

Snaaake is played with the mouse or keyboard. Change your control type in the options or pause menu.
The object of the game is destroy everything you can before time runs out. The snake can crush building, vehicles, people, and more.
Earn points for destruction and unlock new areas.
Tips

Each level has unique hidden challenges. Try to find them all!
Powerups can turn your snake into an unstoppable force. Be sure the collect them during destruction!

Source: The Game Website.

143190.name: FIFA 14
videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Gamescom Best Sports Game of the Year Winner
2013 Global Game Awards Best Sports Game of the Year Winner
2013 Spike (VGX) Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2014 British Academy Game Awards Best Sports Game of the Year Winner
2014 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Winner
143190.description:
Experience the emotion of scoring great goals in FIFA 14. Innovations to the franchise’s award-winning gameplay will make FIFA 14 the complete matchday experience, introducing features that inspire fans to build play through midfield, dictate the tempo of a match and create rewarding opportunities. Great football matches are achieved through measured build up and incredible finishing. A new feature in FIFA 14 called Pure Shot and a brand-new ball physics system will transform shooting, making every shot attempt feel real, and when players connect with the perfect strike, feel exhilarating. FIFA 14 will deliver engaging online features and live services that connect fans to the heartbeat of the sport —and to each other— through EA SPORTS Football Club, making FIFA 14 football's social network, where fans connect, compete and share with millions of others around the world.

Source: The Publisher Website.

143191.name: Stellar Reaches (Issue 21 - Spring 2013)
rpgissuearticle: The Preferred Worlds of the Empty Quarter, 993 Imperial
143191.description:
Cover Art: A quiet moment at a local hookah bar on Ababat, 993 Imperial. While the system doesn’t have the technology to maintain robots, it can afford to contract that work out to Iper’mar professionals. In this way, the many out-of-system visitors can feel more at home. The graphic is titled “Hookah Bar”© Jeremiah Humphries.

From the Contents page:


Letter From The Editor
BITS Task System
Personality Profiles
The Preferred Worlds of the Empty Quarter, 993 Imperial
The Future Awaits

143192.name: TIER: The Enhanced Role Playing Game
rpg: TIER: The Enhanced Role Playing Game
143192.description:
From the introduction:
Welcome to TIER, the enhanced role-playing game. You might be wondering “What makes this game different from other role-playing games?” The answer is “everything”. Imagine a character you would like to create and this game has a way to do it. You begin with one class that is completely customizable. This class, for all purposes, is a blank slate. It only provides basic statistics and allows you to add on whatever you want in order to create your ideal character. You begin by choosing 3 Masteries that give you specific abilities. As you level up, you will gain more Masteries. However, the game has over 100 Masteries to choose from, which will make each and every character different from one another.

User Summary:
Fairly complete rebuild system based on D&D 3.0/3.5 OGL

143193.description:
Tiamat is a rank omega overseer, the greatest commander of the whole Therian army. In control of her specially designed golgoth, she fights the enemy in hand to hand combat, reaping infantry as well as armored fighting vehicles with the same fascinating ease. Her mastery of nanoresources allows her to come back again and again, as long as there are overseers to steal their bodies!
This Hero Box contains:
1 miniature
1 nanogenerator
1 card : Tiamat
143193.name: AT-43 Hero Box: Therian Omega Tiamat

143194.name: The Yawhg
videogamehonor: 2014 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
2014 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee
2014 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
2014 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
143194.description:
The Yawhg is a one- to four-player choose-your-own-adventure game that randomizes a unique story every time you play. The evil Yawhg is returning. How will the town’s locals lead their lives in the meanwhile, and what will they do when the dreaded Yawhg finally arrives? The fate of a community hinges on the characters’ actions, and the decisions of their players.

-Stories which can be played alone, or with friends.

-A fully fleshed-out world, where actions can have dire consequences.

-A randomly generated story that's different every time you play.

-Gorgeous artwork by the award-winning Emily Carroll.

-Over 50 unique endings that can happen to every character.

Source: The Game Website.

143195.description:
Spell Saga is a card based tabletop novel.

In a world past its ending, you'll play as The Last Minstrel, alone in the highlands, searching for the truth about how the world ended. Along the way you'll get lost in an enchanted forest, and find yourself in a dungeon crawl so overwhelmingly large it might take two kitchen tables to get through.

This is a one player solo-style game with magical items, mysterious party members, & dangerous battles. There is no grinding for levels, because the game is built to have you grow as you explore the world & story around you. The major acts of Spell Saga are always the same, but how you get there--and IF you get there, is up to you.

The game play consists of 5 decks, which represent a prelude, three acts and an ending. Players will start each deck with several marked starting cards and play the game by drawing cards and putting them in the correct piles. These piles of cards are organized in specific ways to represent Places to Visit, Items of Interest as well as other pieces of the hero's story and their world. There is even a story pile, and as cards are added the "hero" pile grows stronger.

The game can only progress by drawing new cards, and the main mechanic of drawing cards is only possible by moving through the Place Pile. Players will work their way through as much of the deck as possible, pulling new cards and playing them on the table by placing them in the correct pile.

Of course, each card played can be used to twist the rules of the game, and each Deck can only be solved with a combination of these twists. As Players encounter obstacles such as enemies and lack of Source (re: in game money used to play cards) they'll find themselves digging deeper into the deck, finding new pieces of the story, until the truth about the end of the world--and you're nameless minstrel's part in it--comes to bear.
143195.name: Spell Saga
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 62!!!

143196.name: Privateer 2: The Darkening (Special Edition)
143196.description:
User Summary

A compilation allowing the user to experience the excitement of both "Wing Commander: Privateer" and "Privateer 2: The Darkening" in one package.

Indulge yourself in lucrative space trading and try to stabilize your precarious position by fighting off invading aliens and an array of belligerent pirates.

143197.description:
Z. is a 2-4 player card battle game that pits Survivors against the Fallen (zombies). It combines elements of Magic: The Gathering and other card/tabletop classics with video game sensibilities and a horror movie atmosphere.Each new match allows the players to create and live out their own zombie horror film. Every card in Z. is a high quality image featuring real people and real horror makeup/effects in place of 3D art or illustrations.

In Z., the Survivor and Fallen players take turns playing new cards from their hand, which are drawn from their deck. These can include new characters, weapons, traps, etc. Additional resources needed for playing cards are generated automatically at the beginning of each turn, but may also be manually increased or altered through various gameplay mechanics.

(Since the Fallen cannot “think” and strategize per se, the Fallen player not only controls his or her units directly, but also acts as a sort of director for the overall events of the game . Many of the Fallen’s cards and especially Killstreaks can modify the core rules of the game.)

In the middle of the play field are three Location Decks, each one representing a unique setting (Cabin, Police Station, Hospital, etc.). Everything in Z. revolves around these Location Decks:

-Survivors must send out characters (units) to search the Location Deck for Supplies, items, other units, and objectives.
-The Fallen must simply wipe out the Survivors before they complete their objectives, regardless of what mode is being played.
-Survivor and Fallen units that occupy the same Location can encounter (attack or use abilities on) each other.

The cards found in each Location Deck are also themed after that Location, adding a greater variety to the gameplay and types of cards available. Not all Location Deck cards are Survivor-friendly, however. These Locations are usually overrun with Fallen, as well as other dangers and obstacles.

The Z. Year One "Core Set" includes over 450 cards, with all six Starter Decks for the Survivors and Fallen, plus the first Location Set.
143197.name: Z. Year One

143198.name: Фиаско
143198.description:
User Summary:

Russian translation of Fiasco. Has a different collection of playsets in comparison to the original book, including two developed by the publisher.

143199.name: Pocket Footy
143199.description:
Pocket Footy is a dice game based on Australia Rules Football. 7 custom made dice represent players and actions on the field to simulate a fast, action packed game of Aussie Rules.

It's light, quick and simple to play. 7 dice, 1 bag and instructions - that's all you need!

The 7 dice represent 4 key playing positions, the Umpire who adjudicates who has possession of the ball, a Contest die that determines who wins the ball in open play and the Pass Percentage die that determines if a pass has been successful.

The aim is to get the ball down to your Forward positions and kick a goal.

Aussie Rules football is a fast game and possession changes hands a lot. This game too is fast and hectic with players swapping dice as possession is won & lost.

After 4 quarters of play, the winner is the player with the highest total of goals and points.

It is a dice game, so luck is involved. There is the option to play some advanced rules that allow for re-rolls and a push-you-luck mechanic.

Please enjoy it for a fast, light filler that Aussie Rules fans will love!

143200.name: Jungle Speed: Silver
143200.description:
Jungle Speed just got even faster!

Jungle Speed Dark or Silver – its your choice! Offering new packaging, new cards, all weather-proof, and in a new travel-convenient size! Flip the cards, spot the matching symbols and grab the totem, but grab faster than your friends, or you’ll be stuck with their cards. Dump your whole hand to win – if you can! Jungle Speed is easy to learn and fast to play, with excitement and fun for families and friends of all ages.

FEATURES
•Fast pace and exciting game play.
•Easy to learn.
•Fun for all of your friends and family.
•International best seller!

143201.name: Airline Tycoon Evolution
143201.description:
User Summary

Follow-up to AIRLINE TYCOON. An airline management game -- oversee security operations, keep passengers safe, keep your staff smiling and bring in your flight for a safe landing -- on time.

143202.name: Geist in the Shell
143202.description:
designer summary

Geist in the Shell is a The Esoterrorists scenario specifically designed to kickstart a new campaign. Short on answers but long on questions, it presents a foundation from which a Game Master and their players can create their own The Esoterrorists mystery.

143203.name: Woodland Creatures: A Compendium of Creatures for the Chronicle System
143203.description:
From publisher's web site:

Woodland Creatures [is] a bestiary for the Chronicle System, the rules that power A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying.

This 33-page PDF features animals, beasts, horrors, and legends your characters can encounter in wilderness areas in a homegrown setting utilizing the Chronicle System, or in a Westeros that diverges from the accepted canon.

143204.name: Hellfrost Screen Inserts
143204.description:
[Entered by the submitter.]

Hellfrost Screen Inserts for the Customizable Game Master Screen. Includes all of the main charts needed by the GM.

143205.name: Shaintar:Legends Arise: Players Guide (Revised Edition)
143205.description:
[Taken from the introductory text.]
Shaintar is a complete fantasy-themed campaign setting designed for use with the Savage Worlds Deluxe Rules from Pinnacle Entertainment Group.

It is also a very complete source of fantasy gaming material for anyone who wants to enhance their SW fantasy experience. Here's some of what you will find just in the Player's Guide!


Enhanced rules for magic that help differentiate various styles while still maintaining pure focus on Savage Worlds' "Fast! Furious! Fun!" philsophy.
Various combat Edges and forms to ensure as many approaches to fantasy combat styles as there are to using magic. Unique martial arts, weapon-and-shield Edges, horseback Edges, and much more.
Tons of gear - weapons, traveling gear, kits, and an enhanced approach to armor that really nails the feel of different forms without sacrificing simplicity.
Dozens of new Edges, including Professional, Power, Combat, and Background. More importantly, each Race has a slew of Racial Edges that truly bring out the best qualities in each of the 11 Races provided.


The world of Shaintar is not a place for killing kobolds for their copper pieces.

The world of Shaintar is for Heroes. More than that, it is for Legends.


LEGENDS. NEVER. DIE.

143206.name: Killer Is Dead
videogamehonor: 2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Guy of the Year Nominee
143206.description:
Killer Is Dead takes place in the near future, including such technology as lunar tourism and cybernetic enhancements. The main character is an executioner named Mondo Zappa who receives jobs from the Bryan Execution Firm. This firm, run by a cyborg named Bryan Roses, tasks Mondo with killing dangerous criminals and assassins from around the world. Mondo wields a sword with his right hand but his cybernetic left arm can be converted into many different weapons including guns, drills, and other objects. Although Mondo travels the world as part of the game, Suda calls it a "personal story" of "a man who doesn't show himself much in the public world but still worms his way into society and mercilessly eliminates the evil dispersed in it". "Love and execution" and "how far can you protect someone" are also central themes of the story.

Source: Wikipedia, "Killer Is Dead", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

143207.description:
DreadBall: The Futuristic Sports Game is the hyper-kinetic sci-fi sports game of unparalleled speed and ferocity – a fast, fun and tactical miniature sports board game written by Jake Thornton and created by Mantic Games.

Two coaches compete for victory with teams of beautiful miniatures on a stunning sci-fi pitch. The game is easy to learn, yet challenging, with carefully orchestrated plays and counter attacks hinging on positioning and the mercy of the dice gods.

This expansion adds an additional team made up of Male Corporation Miniatures, the Trontek 29ers.
143207.name: Dreadball: Trontek 29ers

143208.description:
The base game contains 12 myrmidon pieces (two each of six different types) (as well as a 6×7 checkered board and a cotton case). This expansion contains 28 additional pieces (two each of 14 new different types) in order to provide quite a few additional playing configurations. The base game allowed 720 starting combinations for each army, amounting to 518,400 distinct setups, with just its 6 pieces for each team. The Myrmidons Expansion gives each player nearly two million (1,860,480) starting configurations, for well over three trillion (3,461,385,830,400) setups for a six-piece-per-side setup. If you choose the new 12-piece-per-side option, each player will have nearly seven trillion (6,704,425,728,000) setups.

This expansion was first available through nestorbooster.
143208.name: Myrmidons Expansion

143209.name: The Beast of Sucker Creek
143209.description:
Publisher Blurb

Sightings of a hairy, man-like creature in and around Sucker Creek go back hundreds of years—the legends of the Rayado people tell of Ni-teshi-ih; "The Strong One" who lived in the dark swamps of the Sucker Creek basin.

Since white settlement of the region, reports of blood-chilling cries in the night and occasional sightings of the Beast have been a fixture of local gossip. Is it a madman? A crazed bear? Something strange and wholly new to science? No one knows, but those who have crossed paths with it are convinced of one thing—the Beast of Sucker Creek is real, and you don't want to make it angry.

143211.name: Signal Lost
143211.description:
User summary:

Signal Lost is a story game about exploring the Distant Star, a deep-space survey vessel that has gone dark, and facing an alien terror.

It was created for Game Chef 2013.

143212.name: El Futbol en Casa
143212.description:
From the United States of America (who could imagine) comes the world’s best football board game. El fútbol en casa is truly football in the house. Your house. No, it is not a computer game where you pretend to make bicycle kicks, backheel passes, fantastic dribbles, terrific shots, and remarkable saves. It is not a game where the player with the best hand-eye coordination wins.
It is, rather, a football board game where knowledge of football strategy, tactics, and formations is more important than the ability to quickly punch a button or move a lever.
Why pretend you’re something you’re not? You’re not a football superstar and a computer will not make you one.
Why not play a football simulation game where your brain controls movement and play rather than some software program? You don’t have the physical abilities of the great players but you may have more overall, intrinsic knowledge of the game they play.
El fútbol en casa is a chess-like game of strategy and tactics where, in addition to good and bad fortune (always present in any sporting event), knowledge and skill determine the winner.
You are not a player or a coach. You are the team. You pick the formation. You move the players on your team and pass the ball. You make the tackling challenges and take the shots on goal. You commit fouls, suffer injuries, and get carded. You win. You lose. In short, you experience what a football team experiences.
This is an accurate, well-researched, mathematical representation of association football. All 17 Laws of the Game are incorporated in the play.
In addition to the Basic Game that pits two teams of equal strength against one another, a Tournament Play booklet is included that describes how teams of different strengths can play each other. (You could, for example, play all the games of the World Cup Finals.)
This all-wood game is recommended for players 13 years of age and up. Knowledge of football is helpful but not necessary. Also, many materials are included to individualize your game. (If, for example, you don’t like the color of your team’s kits or jerseys, you can make your own.)

(Designer's explanation)

143213.name: TRS-80 Space War
143213.description:
Publisher Advertisement

TRS-80 Space War combines logic with luck into an exciting space simulation. Imagine yourself the captain of a Federation starship! Your mission is to destroy three Klingon vessels which have invaded your space sector. A Klingon ship is hidden in one of the 48 quadrants which comprise the sector. You may fire into a quadrant by entering the desired coordinates (coordinates are given on a sector map). If a Klingon is in your target quadrant, you will destroy him. If not, you will be given a "Trajectory Analysis" on which to base your next shot. Remember, the Klingons may fire at you at any moment! If they do, the odds are 1 to 4 that your ship will be destroyed. If your shields hold and the enemy's torpedo is deflected, the Klingon will immediately move to another quadrant.

143214.description:
Domain is a tabletop card game for 2-4 players, or up to 8 players during team play matches. It focuses on a world building element, where all players contribute to an ever expanding playing field. Roads connect to Soul Wells, which are used to score the game and provide the magical energy players use to summon monsters or cast hexes. Players move along the system of rolls with a dice roll. Roads may also have other effects, such as reducing movement over harsh terrain, or increasing a player's draw.

Summoned Monster cards may be stationed in a controlled Soul Well to guard them against other players, or left in a player's hand, so that they may attempt to conquer other players' Soul Wells. So there is a strong balance between defending your territory, while having enough strength to expand into enemy territory as well. Hexes are used to manipulate the playing field, support combat or increase draw capacity.
When combat does occur, it has been designed to be accessible and casual, in which battles may be resolved quickly and easily without complex counting or score keeping mechanisms. This keeps the focus of the game on strategic use of the world and unique card abilities to play to a Soul Well's power.

By matching Soul Well or monster Domains with your Lord's (player token piece), a player can boost the power of his creatures, and make his territory more difficult to conquer, or activate specific Domain abilities for his monsters.

An average game takes 30 minutes to an hour for 2 people and 1 hour to 3 for 4 players. It all depends on how players shape their gaming world :)
143214.name: Domain: Lords of Ether

143215.name: Pokémon X and Y
videogamehonor: 2013 Global Game Awards Best Handheld Game of the Year Winner
2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Nintendo Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Song of the Year Nominee
2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Villain of the Year Nominee
2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Guy of the Year Winner
2013 Spike (VGX) Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Spike (VGX) Best RPG of the Year Nominee
2014 D.I.C.E. Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2014 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Golden Joystick Handheld Game of the Year Winner
2014 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
2014 Japan Game Awards Japanese Game of the Year Winner
143215.description:
Pokémon X and Y are upcoming role-playing video games developed by Game Freak and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo 3DS. They are the very first installments in the sixth generation of the main series of Pokémon games, and the very first in the handheld main series of games to be featured with polygonal 3D graphics. The two games will be released worldwide in October 2013.

Like the many games before it, Pokémon X and Pokémon Y see players in the role of a Pokémon Trainer who travels across one of the various regions of the setting, catching creatures known as Pokémon and using them to battle against other trainers.Along with various Pokémon from previous generations, X and Y will introduce many new species of Pokémon, which include the three new starter Pokémon: the rodent-like Grass-type Chespin, the vulpine Fire-type Fennekin, and the frog-like Water-type Froakie.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pokemon x", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

143217.name: Fairy Tale Assassin League: Snow White?  Not Anymore
143217.description:
Fairy Tale Assassin League is a storytelling card game that asks the question: "What happens when Snow White goes to Las Vegas and turns bad?" There are no more happily ever afters.

The game starts with players choosing a fairy tale character; one will be the villain, the remainder good. Each character starts in one of six locations (restaurant, parking lot, theater, stage, kitchen and back alley). The first act of the game is to come up with reasons why the bad guy has to go down. The bad guy starts by bragging about how bad they are. The heroes then say how they have been personally hurt by him. Players can jump in with suggestions for other people’s stories.

The rest of the game is about bringing the villain down (and maybe to justice). The bad guy starts the game. Players take turns to add to the story, assisted by a tableau of scene cards (representing some key point in a revenge story plot) and action cards that can be played from hand. Another player’s version of events can be challenged by playing an action card. Challenges are resolved by rolling dice, with the winner gaining the card their opponent used. All cards are worth victory points.

The aim of the game is to score the most victory points while also telling an interesting story.

Multiple FTAL decks are available, and they can be combined for a larger scale game.

143219.name: Snitch!
143219.description:
Snitch! is a stand-alone game based on cops working to solve crimes by hearing "The-Word-Out-On-The-Street". In this game, different types of information is gathered from Snitches. In order for this information to be valuable to the authorities, it must be, not only found, but then also delivered to the Police Station / DA.

Cops start with nothing, and must establish sources, and then use them to break the case wide open!

Snitch! is inspired by all of the many American TV shows about Police Work.

143220.name: Under Xylarthen's Tower
143220.description:
user summary:
A six level semi-gonzo, old-school OD&D dungeon crawl with some homebrew rules included for character generation.

from the introduction:
The dungeon levels below the tower of the wizard Xylarthen began life as an attempt to create an ‘authentic’ dungeon using the random dungeon stocking methods outlined in Book 3, The Underworld & Wilderness Adventures, with an eye towards creating something playable as a one-shot at the 35th annual Winter War game convention in Champaign, Illinois. Because I am the kind of gamer who enjoys rolling on many random die charts, I also employed some of the tables found in the Judges Guild publication Ready Ref Sheets, particularly the elegantly simple random dungeon charts and the goofy magical statue generator.

143221.name: The Wing Commander Role-Playing Game Volume One: Player's Guide
143221.description:
From publisher blurb:

IN THE DISTANT FUTURE, MANKIND IS LOCKED IN A DEADLY WAR...

The Wing Commander Role-Playing Game brings the wonder and grandeur of the ground-breaking video game series to the gaming table. Compiled using information gathered over two decades by fans of the original series, WCRPG has everything you need to create your own adventures in the Wing Commander Universe.

In this volume, you'll find:

A simple, yet flexible character creation system allowing unlimited numbers of possible characters based on eighty unique archetypes and full details on sixteen unique sapient races.
Full creation rules for vehicles and capital ships, as well as a full catalog of vehicles and capital ships from the original games as well as new fan-created content.
Rules on navigating the Wing Commander Universe, including data on the locations of star systems in thirteen unique Sectors of space.
Flexible combat rules allowing players to fight with as much detail and complexity as they wish.

143222.name: The Wing Commander Role-Playing Game Volume Two: Gamemaster's Guide
143222.description:
From publisher blurb:

IN THE DISTANT FUTURE, MANKIND IS LOCKED IN A DEADLY WAR...

The Wing Commander Role-Playing Game brings the wonder and grandeur of the ground-breaking video game series to the gaming table. Compiled using information gathered over two decades by fans of the original series, WCRPG has everything you need to create your own adventures in the Wing Commander Universe.

In this volume, you'll find:

Full creation rules for communities, planets, star systems and whole sectors.
Procedures for adding new items, objects, weapons and armor to any adventure.
Guidelines on creating adventures, including a list of adventure ideas and procedures for developing plots.
A compendium and primer to the Wing Commander Universe, including a timeline of events, details on over 200 characters, and a list of lifeforms.

143223.name: Prelude to Goddard
143223.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dateline: 2654.312
Hawkins System, Downing Quadrant, Vega Sector

The Kilrathi have destroyed their own colony on Warhammer XII.

From the sheer magnitude of the devastation, it's clear that no
conventional weapon was used.

What have the Cats come up with that could cause this?

It's your job to find out. Because one thing is absolutely certain:

It's only a matter of time before whatever caused the destruction of the Warhammer colony is used on a Confederation world...

Prelude to Goddard is a mission developed for the Wing Commander
Role-Playing Game. This guidebook contains all the information
you need to conduct a daring reconnaissance raid on a Kilrathi
Star Post, including:

A simple, yet flexible character creation system.
A set of ready-made characters, allowing players to jump right into the game.
Details on ships and vehicles from the original games.
Flexible rules allowing players to play with as much detail and complexity as they wish.

143224.name: Enyo
143224.description:
From publisher blurb:

On 2639.033, forces of the Kilrathi empire land on the human-occupied word of Enyo, putting a quarter of a million human prisoners under orbital guns. Thus began the Enyo Engagement, in which the Terran Confederation executed a masterful plan over the course of one week to drive the Kilrathi from the system.

At least, that's the way the history books say it happens. Whether or not it will actually turn out that way is entirely up to you...

Enyo is a miniature campaign developed for the Wing Commander Role-Playing Game. This guidebook contains all of the information you need to oust the Kilrathi from the Enyo System, including:

A simple, yet flexible character creation system.
A set of read-made characters, allowing players to jump right into the game.
Customized ships and vehicles for use with the campaign.
Flexible rules that allow players to play with as much detail and complexity as they wish.

143225.name: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney Trilogy HD
videogamecompilation: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Justice For All
Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney: Trials and Tribulations
143225.description:
User Summary
Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney Trilogy HD is a compilation of the first three games in the Ace Attorney series with new high-definition artwork.

143226.name: Pool 1.5
143226.description:
User Summary

Play Eight Ball, Rotation, Straight Pool or Nine Ball with 1-4 players.

Use the joystick/paddles to aim your shot, apply English, and the strength of the shot.

Other options allow you to control how fast the balls move and how much friction there is on the table.

143227.name: Trickshot
143227.description:
User Summary

Play Snookers, Billiards, Three Ball or Open Table pool with 1-4 players.

Move and place balls to set-up and perform various trick shots.

Use the joystick/paddles to aim your shot, apply English, and the strength of the shot.

Other options allow you to control how fast the balls move and how much friction there is on the table.

143228.name: Tomodachi Collection
videogamehonor: 2010 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
143228.description:
"Tomodachi Collection (トモダチコレクション, lit. "Friend Collection") is a life simulation handheld video game for the Nintendo DS. It was released only in Japan on June 18, 2009.

Gameplay
The gameplay is similar to The Sims and Animal Crossing. The gamer uses Miis to interact in this game. Players can transfer their Miis from their Wii console to their Nintendo DS, make friends, perform everyday tasks, and give clothes, food, and special items to the Miis to gain experience. Constructed places can be opened once the player has earned enough in-game money by performing tasks."

Source: Wikipedia, "Tomodachi Collection", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

143229.name: Tomodachi Collection: New Life
143229.description:
"Tomodachi Collection: New Life (トモダチコレクション 新生活 Tomodachi Korekushon: Shin Seikatsu) is a life simulation handheld video game for the Nintendo 3DS. It was released only in Japan on April 18, 2013 and was the best-selling game in Japan during the week of its release, selling about 404.858 units. Famitsu gave the game a rating of 36 out of 40."

Source: Wikipedia, "Tomodachi Collection", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

143230.name: 7 Grand Steps
videogamehonor: 2013 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee
2013 Indie Prize Most Innovative Game Winner
143230.description:
There is a wonderful tale within you. It is the story of your ancestors and how you came to be.

'7 Grand Steps' is the game that connects people to the cultural roots of western civilization.

From the sweat of laborers to the perspective of kings, experience the wonder of a family lineage that survived the changing ages. Or did they survive? How you guide them will determine their fate.

This is a game of many layers. First, moving pawns around the wheel represents basic striving in life. Forward to opportunity. Behind is an untimely death. Spend resources to advance pawns, but to get resources pawns must retreat.

The basic goal is to collect enough beads to earn a legend. (strings of beads once facilitated oral tradition) Legends are stories of family greatness: Discovering technology, ascending in society, and heroic deeds. Legends provide advantages against the inevitable Challenge of the Age.

Legends and Challenges are only a small part of the stories told. Rites of passage, romance, snapshots of daily life, sibling rivalry, etc. These stories bond players to each family in the lineage. Each generation is guided long enough for a player to know them. Every family tells an unique, engaging, interactive story.

The last layer of play contains the ruling games. Should a family reach the ruling class, they can play a simulation of ruling in the current age. Lose this game, and they fall in society. Although playing ruling games are optional, these simulations will run in the background, and the family will be affected by their results.

As generations strive through the ages, stories change, to reflect changes in society. They slowly build a grand and personal legend of western ancestors.

Source: The Game Website.

143231.name: Quanionsqueste
143231.description:
(from the back of the book)
Over the years, evil has spread to countries, hearts and souls of men. As Gareth, the heart of the Middle Empire, was haunted by demonic forces and the church of Praios lost the eternal light, the victory of darkness seemed only a matter of time. Despair and fear captured the faithful, and even in the Fellowship of the Sun voices have been raised that the punishment of the Lord Praios has beeon coming over a church that was no longer worthy of his grace.

Over the devastated City of Light dark clouds loom. The creatures of the Adversary move in the shadows and gather to the coup de grace a shattered church. But only in the darkness the light of hop shines brightly! Guided by a divine prophecy pilgrims, priests and heroes travel outwards in search of a new light, that could give hope to humanity. In the footsteps of a saint they embark on the quest of Quanion! With confidence and courage they defy the darkness, explore ancient secrets from the beginning of the faith in Praios, engage in the dispute between traditionalists and principalists and face the shadows that lurk in their own hearts.

143232.name: Äther, Dampf und Stahlgiganten
143232.description:
(from the back of the book)
Embark on an adventurous journey and discover a new world of unimagined possibilities. Charter the next airship and discover the secrets of the Amazon basin or the legends of ancient desert ruins, meet macabre priests, hungry predatory lizards or devious spies. Discover strange inhabitants on Mercury, rich treasures on Venus or forgotten cities on Earth. But be careful that you do not suddenly find yourselves behind "Martian curtains"!

Whether you travel on steam carriage through the icy darkness of Mercury, explore the misty jungles of Venus on Pachyosauri or provide wild chases through the Sierra Nevada in a steel colossus: In this adventure book you will find suggestions and ideas for all sorts of fantastic adventures between steam and ether.

The book contains the following 8 short scenarios:

Meister der Magie
Das Geheimnis der vergessenen Stadt
Kreaturen aus der Dunkelheit
Tom Fleet und sein Stahlkoloss
Der Fluch der Wüste
Das verwunschene Tal
Die letzte Reise
Gefangen in Noachis

143233.name: AT-43 Hero Box: Captain H. Newton
143233.description: Captain H. Newton is an officer and hero of the U.N. army. Aboard Number One, she has no rival. Besides no matter if she is on foot or aboard her Fire Toad, she can repair any armored fighting vehicle including her own. And destroying her strider is not enough to eliminate her: the miniature on foot is then deployed to carry on fighting!

143234.name: AT-43 Hero Box: Atis Astarte
143234.description: Atis-Astarte is an unusual rank alpha overseer, a commander for the Therian army and its first hero. She enjoys battle so much that she specialized in close combat. Leading her grim golems, she attacks anything within her reach with celebrated fury. Her secret move: a unique routine allowing her to teleport her unit in contact with the enemy!

143235.name: World Rebellion II
143235.description:
User Summary

In this online version of the board game "Risk" your primary objective is world domination or conquest, by eliminating all opponents. You control a few starting territories and control armies in an effort to dominate over all enemies.

143236.name: AT-43 Unit Box: Steel Tac Arms
143236.description:
This Unit Box contains a unit of three steel TacArms: two standard TacArms and a TacArm leader, each equipped with two laser guns. One of them can be promoted Sergeant. Particularly resilient, the TacArms are also capable of piercing even the thickest of armor with their great laser guns. Showing exceptional accuracy and impressive attack rate, these weapons make the steel TacArms one of the most dreadful units in the White Stars army. For further tactical possibilities, one of them can become a Sergeant.

Contents:
• Box of 3 miniatures, 3 Steel TacArm, 1 Torso / kit leader, with laser gun x 2.
• 2 cards : Steel TacArm Sgt, Steel TacArm

143237.name: AT-43 Unit Box: Grim Golems
143237.description:
Grim golems are assassins and hunters. With their optical jamming devices, they can step out on the frontline without fear. There is no point establishing any complex strategy: they run straight for the enemy, drowning him in waves of fire before finally engaging him to give him a taste of their reaper blades.
• Box of 6 miniatures.
4 Grim golems. Armament: reaper blades/reaper blades.
1 Grim golem. Armament: flamer.
1 Grim golem leader. Armament: reaper blades/reaper blades.
• 3 cards : Grim golem.

143238.description: The Battle for Sector 219, a sequel to The Battle for Hill 218, uses the same game system as its predecessor, but with new units. In the game, each player fields an army, represented by cards, and tries to occupy his opponent's base while protecting his own. You must maintain your supply lines and destroy enemy units to conquer the enemy base while protecting your own.
143238.name: The Battle for Sector 219

143239.name: AT-43 Unit Box: Strielitz Kolossus
143239.description:
The Strielitz Kolossus chastise the enemy of the Revolution with steel and fire. With grenade launcher fastened to one arm and a flamer fastened to the other, they make their enemies tremble in righteous terror.

Standing testimony of the success of the Red Blok, Strielitz Kolossus units are irreproachably proficient: what they cannot burn, they pulverize. They reap the infantry and mow through battlesuit units with terrifying casualness.

The Strielitz Kolossus are infantry hunters, comfortable at all distances and against any category of infantry.

This unit box includes:
•Three miniatures: 2 Strielitz Kolossus, 1 Strielitz Kolossus Sgt.
•Two cards: Strielitz Kolossus, Strielitz Kolossus Sgt.

143240.name: AT-43 Unit Box: Fire Toad U.N.A.
143240.description:
Toads are the Type * AFV of the UNA in AT-43 and come in four different flavours. Toads are quick with 25 movement, They are deadly, with a wide assortment of weapon loadouts for every situation, and they are cheap. While not having the armour of the Red Blok, Toads are very resilient when in a Mind company. This list gives all AFV’s a repair for free so a unit of 3 toads can repair 3 damage a turn. This is before you even start to throw Steel Trooper Engineers into the mix. The toads are fairly quick and are great for flanking the enemy.

Fire Toad
armed with 2 laser guns the Fire Toad is the jack of all trades. It can take out everything from afv’s to infantry. This is the most common variant of toad used in many lists because of this fact.

Light Prince
A hybrid between the Iron Rain and the Fire Toad, the light prince packs a MG and a laser gun. It is able to throw 3 mg shots and 1 lasergun shot at its target. It still retains the ability to engage AFVs while being able to put out enough fire to have a hope of killing infantry that are in cover.

Iron Rain
This guy is a battlesuit killing machine. A full unit of Iron Rain’s put out 18 MG shots a turn. When shooting at a type *** infantry unit in full cover you’re bound to score a few wounds due to the sheer number of dice. The Lancelot is better suited to killing more lightly armoured units and grounding those suits that don’t have stability (Red Blok and Therians). if you’re taking these guys, its to neutralize your opponents ungroundable battlesuits. Otherwise you’re better off with Lancelots.

Lancelot
The Lancelot is an infantry killing monster. with 2 grenade launchers it puts out a lot of indirect fire. Note that the card is a misprint and each grenade launcher only gets 1 shot instead of the printed 3. Even still, a unit of 2 of these guys can get the all important double damage template. This weapon grounds units and ignores cover so it is a better choice if you are facing Red Blok or Therians as their type *** infantry can still be grounded.

Contains:
-1 figurine: Fire Toad Mk IV, 2 light grenade launchers, 2 light laser cannons, 2 light MG
-8 cards - Fire Toad, Fire Toad Sgt., Fire Toad Light Prince, Fire Toad Light Prince Sgt., Fire Toad Iron Rain, Fire Toad Iron Rain Sgt., Fire Toad Lancelot, Fire Toad Lancelot Sgt.

143241.name: Priset för ett liv
143241.description:
User summary:

Priset för ett liv (The price of a life) is an adventure module for the Swedish role-playing game Western. Apart from the adventure, the module contains new rules that will be introduced in the upcoming 4th edition of the core rule book.

The module contains an adventure/rule booklet, nine handouts, seven pre-generated characters and a new transparent plastic shotclock overlay.

143242.name: Nova Raider
143242.description:
Nova Raider is a massive multiplayer online roleplaying space game.

You are a spacecraft pilot and just escaped an enemy raid. You're now lost in the vast universe, searching for your mother planet !

You'll encounter many monsters and pirates as you explore the numerous galaxies. Improve your spaceship, gear it up with powerful weapons and choose your vessel's class : raider, tank, support, trader or miner.

Nova Raider is centered on collaboration and team play so you'll need all the help you can get! Join forces with other players to fight the all mighty bosses and fulfill the co-op quests!

Source: The Developer Website.

143243.name: Loco Lingo Kindergarten
143243.description:
Loco Lingo Kindergarten is a collection of five word-related games that are played with 12 cards showing items, 3 wooden figures and 1 color die.

The games are:

Warm-Up: Not really a game, but an activity to identify all the cards and figures, so that all the children know what everything is.
Grab It!: The game leader reads out a story. Whenever an object is mentioned that corresponds with one of the cards or figures, the children should grab that card or figure from the table. If they take the correct item, they get to keep it. Whomever has the most items at the end of the story wins the game.
Focus Pocus!: Six random cards and/or figures are placed on the table. The game leader reads out a story. Whenever an object is mentioned that corresponds with one of the cards or figures that is not in the table, the children should react by saying "it's in the box". The first player to do so, gets an item from the table. Whenever an object is mentioned that corresponds with one of the cards or figures that is already held by one of the players, the children should react by saying "it's already gone". The first player to do so, gets an item from the table. Whomever has the most items at the end of the story wins the game.
Stories about Kindergarten: In turn, each player choose a figure and draw a card. They then tell a short story about that figure and the item on the card. The card is then placed facedown next to the figure. This continues until there are four cards in front of each figure. Then, the players take turn rolling the die. They then have to remember what item is on the first card next to the figure corresponding to the colour rolled. If they guess correctly, they get to keep the card. Whomever has the most cards at the end of the story wins the game.
What does it do?: In turn, each player chooses a card and describes what you can do with the item on the card. The other players then guess what card is being described. Whomever guesses correctly gets to keep the card. The game continues until only three cards are left. Whomever has the most cards at the end of the story wins the game.

143244.name: PACS Set I: Heroes for Hire
143244.description:
Publisher Blurb:
PACS (Pocket Adventures Card System) is an entire RPG (Role Playing Game) that fits into a deck of cards. As a non-collectable card game, with a Base Set of PACS and a pocketful of change you're ready for hours of play where no two sessions need ever be the same. Players familiar with RPGs will be right at home, and those new to RPGs will find PACS as an excellent entry point for the genre.

PACS plays like a typical tabletop RPG with the following changes:

You flip coins instead of rolling dice.
For most actions in PACS you flip three coins, count the number of ‘heads’, add that to the appropriate Aptitude Score, and determine whether your result is a success or failure. If you want to roll dice, determine a way to divide the numbers on your die into a 50/50 chance. Common options are evens/odds or high/low.

There is no battle-grid.
It is assumed each Hero and Foe is in range of each other. The DM can adjudicate differently as they see fit.

There are no hit-points.
A Hero or Foe has three statuses: Uninjured, Injured, and Defeated. A card’s orientation represents what state the Hero of Foe is in.

Even though there are no 'experience points', characters can still advance.
PACS cannot replace the complexity of a typical tabletop RPG, nor does it try to. It is ideal for introducing new players to RPGs, filling time between game sessions, or serving as a quick and fun way to allow other players to DM. As such, PACS Set 1 allows for Heroes to become more powerful as they gather Loot. PACS Set 2 offers options for leveling characters up (and the options are fully compatible with Set 1).

143245.name: PACS Set II: The Next Level
143245.description:
Publisher Blurb:
PACS (Pocket Adventures Card System) is an entire RPG (Role Playing Game) that fits into a deck of cards. As a non-collectable card game, with a Base Set of PACS and a pocketful of change you're ready for hours of play where no two sessions need ever be the same. Players familiar with RPGs will be right at home, and those new to RPGs will find PACS as an excellent entry point for the genre.
