As such, PACS Set 1 allows for Heroes to become more powerful as they gather Loot. PACS Set 2 offers options for leveling characters up (and the options are fully compatible with Set 1).

What's specific to Set 2?
For the Dungeon Master, there are generic 'Foes' (such as Brute, Soldier, Minor Undead, etc.) that fit a large number of situations, many Loot and Foe cards provide multiple options, new Foe 'modifier' cards (such as Vampiric, Lycan, etc.) expand your options further, and 'weaker' Foes support playing with as few as one or two Heroes.
For the Player, there are options for mounts, familiars, leveling up, and there is more low Value loot to help you earn loot more frequently.

143246.name: What? Girls Night Edition
143246.description: Party game, What? Girls Night Edition, is a spin-off of the original What? party game. Made for girls only, this party game is great for large groups of people. A hilarious party game, your girlfriends will be guessing who could have possibly said what! Players answer three categories of questions: General, Fill In The Blank, and Sticky Situation. Girls can be as honest or as deceitful as they want, but the goal is to fool your friends so they can't guess your answer! Shock value anticipated as players give their most creative answers. Fun party game for bachelorette parties, girls night, pajama parties and any occasion where the girls can kick the boys out for a few giggles!

143248.name: Mastermind II
143248.description:
Publisher Advertisement

MASTERMIND II - Lots of people have written digital MASTERMIND programs that create the code and give you the clues. This one will also let you make the code and give the clues. You can play either way or take turns with the computer. 10 rounds make up a game, and at the end of each round, player averages are displayed. Becase this is a machine language program, it takes the computer 3 seconds or less to come up with a guess.

MASTERMIND I - Same as above but written in BASIC for 4K machines. It only plays one way, the computer makes the code and gives the clues; you must break the code in 10 turns or less.

143249.name: Catan: New England
143249.description: Catan: New England is an expansion for The Settlers of Catan that requires all of the components from that game in order to play other than the hex-shaped resource tiles. Instead of creating an island from those tiles, players compete for resources and building locations on a fixed map that features the six states that comprise New England in the U.S.: Maine, New Hampshire, Vermont, Massachusetts, Connecticut and Rhode Island.

143250.description:
For 2 to 4 players, Villainous Vikings is a rousing game of Viking exploration and conquest. With players confronted by constant Raid or Trade dilemmas, the decisions will take you to the highest seat in Asgard next to Odin.

Your goal in Villainous Vikings, by designer Jeremy Stoltzfus, is to amass as many Valhalla Points as possible so that after Ragnarök occurs your Captain has the best seat in Valhalla to tell his tales of battle and drink his mead. You will gain Valhalla Points by raiding, trading, and battling the other Captains who are also vying for Odin’s favor.
After one of the players has been declared the victor of Ragnarök, each player will tally up their Valhalla Points to determine their overall standing with Odin the All-Father and the other Gods; whoever is in the best standing is considered the greatest Viking(s) in history!
143250.name: Villainous Vikings
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep_001 – Our origins & Villainous Vikings
The Long View: Carcassonne

143251.name: Roleplayers Chronicle (Issue 2 - Winter 2013)
143251.description:
(back cover)

Welcome to the second issue of the Roleplayers Chronicle magazine - the yearly magazine to support the tabletop role-playing game news website Roleplayers Chronicle at roleplayerschronicle.com.

143252.name: Zombie Quest
143252.description:
The enjoyable otherworldly atmosphere, cold-hearted villains and charismatic minions are all here to entertain you with the most addictive board game!

Board game reinvented

You don't have to spend 30 minutes on a round, you don't have to roll a dice and move checkers. Train your brains with the funny and appealing Zombie Quest!

Notorious villains

Each round is increasingly difficult as your next enemy is more inventive and smart than the previous one. Can you keep up with it?

Powerful special abilities

Don’t pin all your hopes on your army only. Use your otherworldly powers to win battles because your enemies won’t hesitate to hex you!

Duels with others

Share the fun as you don’t need another device to play your friends. Win a level to unlock the pass and play mode and try if Dracula can beat Frankenstein!

Source: The Game Website.

143253.name: OLO
143253.description:
Universally appealing and instantly understandable, OLO is a social game of dexterity.

Marking the beginning of a new generation of social board games the minimal design and addictive gameplay makes OLO an instant classic.

The aim of the game is to get as many OLOs as possible into your target zone.

Cunning strategy and skilful techniques are a must to claim victory...

The app features two player, four player, and online multiplayer with voice chat allowing players to share their experiences with friends.

The stripped back aesthetics, intuitive nature of the gameplay, and calming soundscape work together to appeal to players of all ages. There’s no barriers when it comes to OLO, everyone can get involved.

For more information on OLO, please visit http://www.ologame.com

Source: Official Press Kit.

143254.description:
The Story

It is the 23rd century. There is an energy and resource scarcity on Earth. The planet is exploited and the world economy is about to collapse. Desperately Spaceships be sent out to explore the neighboring planets. A crystalline substance, shining like gold, with incredible energy content is discovered on Mars. It gets named Rich Yield Crystal Energy, or in short: RYCE.

RYCE could satisfy the insatiable hunger for energy of Earth if… yes if it is possible to collect the material on Mars, and bring it back to Earth. Every space traveling nation is called to participate and thus to secure a part of the energy source. But the difficulties are considerable. The extraction system must be developed and transported to Mars.

Hostile life conditions and water scarcity in this EMPIRE OF SAND do one last thing, but the challenge is accepted.

But then the shock: Mars is inhabited. The Martians live in underground cities and were not detected by the sensors.The Martians turn out to be cooperative and strongly point to the dangers of the planet. The mighty CRAWLERS, which move through the sandy deserts of the planet and cause dangerous sandstorms. And a mysterious faction, that calls itself THE BROTHERHOOD and that has no sense of humor when competing with their resources.

A difficult task, which can only be overcome with the support of all factions...if it were not for the rivalry among the nations!


Description

Ryce: Empire of Sand is a area control and resource-management strategy game with a thematic background on a variable game board with interactive mechanisms, low downtime, low luck elements and a variable and calculable game-time. Conflicts in the game are solved by majorities instead of fights and war.

Each player takes the role of one of six space traveling nations of Earth (USA, Europe, Russia, China, Japan, India). The Players land on Mars with their bases, recruit astronauts, and send astronauts out to collect resources, install mines, build tunnels, and taking over control of mines from other players. Collected resources are spent in more astronauts, new mines, new technologies (to upgrade the collection of resources, the amount of astronauts, the movement-range etc.),or in influence to the three mighty factions on Mars (The EARTH, The MARTIANS, and the BROTHERHOOD). From the factions the players get control of special units and also get influence cards, that they can play in their turn to get different benefits. Through the controlled mines, the level of technology and the influence on the factions and their special units the players get victory points. The player with the most victory points wins the game for himself and his nation.
143254.name: Ryce: Empire of Sand

143255.description:
Prepare the Goblins! The Zombies have arrived!
Fighter Zombie, Thief Zombie, Wizard Zombie, oh my....

The Zombies will move towards your Village. If a Zombie can go through the Village Gate, you lose. You must coordinate the Goblins to defend your beloved Village. The Village Gate has space for only 3 Goblins at a time, so choose your Goblins carefully!

Goblins vs Zombies is a Tower Defense card game for 1-3 Players. It takes around 15 minutes per player.

Goblins vs Zombies has:
- 16 kinds of Zombies in 3 types: Ground, Flying, Invisible;
- 23 kinds of Goblins;
- 5 Modes of Play: solo, cooperative and competitive;
- a total of only 106 cards, a BIG game in a small box!

The 5 Modes of Play are:
Mode A: Training. A co-op introduction game for 1-3 Players to learn how to play the game.
Mode B: Last Stand. A struggling solo game. Double the Zombie, double the fun!
Mode C: Survival. A competitive game for 2 or 3 Players. Do your best to send the Zombies in your Field to other Field, and be the last Player standing to win the game.
Mode D: The Boss. A co-op game for 1-3 Players. All Players must work together to destroy the Boss.
Mode E: Goblins vs Zombies. A head to head game for 2 Players. Who will win, Goblins or Zombies?
143255.name: Goblins vs Zombies

143256.name: X-Wing Fighter
143256.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game represents an unlicensed use of elements of the Star Wars franchise.




Publisher Advertisement

The Death Star Space Station, under the command of Darth Vader, is the most powerful weapon the universe has ever known. A frontal attack by any other craft would be absolute suicide. However, intelligence delivered to Republic headquarters by the androids R2D2 and C3PO gives a faint hope of a successful attack by a small 1- or 2-passenger X-wing fighter.

There is a small unshielded exhaust port on the surface of the Death Star that leads directly to the main reactor. Since it is an emergency thermal port in case the reactor overheats, it could not be shielded. If you can slip your small fighter past the Death Star's defenses and make a direct hit on the thermal exhaust port with a torpedo, there is a chance the torpedo will penetrate the main reactor and start a chain reaction, destroying the Death Star. It is a slim chance, but it is the only one the Republic has. Obi-Wan Kenobi gave his life to get the message here; so he considered it very important.

The X-wing fighter is a small 1- or 2-passenger rocket that is, quite frankly, obsolete. It is armed only with a laser cannon and 3 torpedoes. Use the laser cannon to fight off any imperial fighters, and save the torpedoes for the Death Star. The target acquisition radar can detect targets in excess of 100,000 km away but can only display targets within 20,000 km. Therefore, you will be warned of approaching targets on the right side of your control panel before they are displayed in the radar screen.

143257.name: X-Wing II
143257.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game represents an unlicensed use of elements of the Star Wars franchise.




Publisher Advertisement

You are Pilot of an X-Wing fighter...

Your Mission, Destroy the Death Star!

Where X-Wing I left Death Star looming on the screen, X-Wing II lets you guide your fighter into the trench, find the exhaust port, aim and fire -- all the while avoiding enemy fighters. Excellent graphics, 12 levels of play, and extensive INKEY$ commands make this one of our most exciting "real-time" games.

143258.name: Troll's Gold
143258.description:
Introduction to program listing in SoftSide Magazine

Trolls never have done very well in public opinion polls, probably because of their penchant for eating any unsuspecting traveler who strays their way. The "miscreant muncher" in this particular game is no exception in that regard, but the fact that he's sitting on enough gold to underwrite the national debt could well make the trip worth your while. One word of caution: reaching the gold is only half the battle -- he'll be doing everything he can to prevent you from getting it back out again.

Publisher Advertisement

A chase game for children of all ages. The troll is deep within the caves. Your goal is to descend to his gold-filled lair and escape with the booty without him catching you.

143259.name: Tiki Towers 2
143259.description:
The monkeys are back. And this time it's personal!

Swing into action with an all-new set of primate puzzles in the fantastic sequel to the award-winning hit. Tackle 30 levels in this hilarious physics-based challenge. Build bridges and towers out of bamboo, coconuts, and vines to overcome water, lava and other hazards. Pick up objects to improve your progress and clear levels with multiple exits. With 10 new awards, a Monkey Theater surprise, and a host of new perils, you'll go ape crazy!


Tackle 30 all-new physics-based challenges.
Build bridges and towers out of bamboo, coconuts and vines to overcome obstacles.
Employ your monkey smarts to utilize helpful tools such as magnets and bolts.
Clear levels with multiple exits and collect objects to improve progress.
Swing through the Monkey Republic using the Island Map level selector.


Source: The Game Website.

143260.name: End Zone
143260.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Those of you who missed November SoftSide's cover article will now have to pay if you want to play this superb simulation of the time-honored American Sport.

A two-player game, each side is given the opportunity to choose its respective strategies and the TRS-80 works out the outcome. The game is played in four 15-minute quarters and has provisions for time-outs, fumbles, interceptions, touch-backs -- even penalty calls.

It's the game of football, played just the way you remember it, from the toss of the coin to the two-minute warning, with
nothing left out -- er, uh, nothing that is, except the cheerleaders!

143261.name: Stay Alight!
143261.description:
Our eyes see just a small part of what happens around. But at this time, in micro world small brave bulb continue his struggle against monsters, appeared from garbage that left by people.

Stay Alight® is a logic arcade at iOS and Android with very detail, hi resolution graphic for retina display and realistic physic. User should choose the right trajectory for his bullets to kill all monsters and pass 20 levels at each campaign.

Only you can help Bulb to save the world from garbage monsters and make it more clean!

Source: The Developer Website.

143262.name: Sid Meier's Ace Patrol
143262.description:
The skies over Europe are a dangerous place, where ace pilots lead their squadrons to glorious victory or crushing defeat! Take control of dozens of the most famous fighter planes of WWI and head into the dogfight. Roll, slip, and loop to get the drop on enemy aces. Upgrade your fighters over the course of your campaign and promote your best pilots so they learn new skills to give them an edge in battle. Can you change the tide of the war? Or will you go down in flames to an enemy ace?

Features:

Advance from Aviator to Ace in over 120 missions using 30 authentic aircraft
Earn promotions, equipment upgrades and advanced maneuvers like rolls, loops and slips
Unlock new Aces with special skill sets to expand your gameplay options
Tilt and motion camera controls offer an immersive 3D strategy experience
Single Player campaign & Multiplayer missions with leaderboards through Game Center




Source: The Developer Website.

143263.name: Time Bomb
143263.description:
Game Manual

Seconds count. Somewhere deep inside a towering skyscraper the time bomb is ticking away. Would you be able to locate and disarm this explosive device in time to save the building and its inhabitants? Maybe, but for everyone's sake, you'd better get in a little practice with this computer simulation first!

143264.name: Cribbage (The Software Exchange)
143264.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Here it is -- the October SoftSide feature program on digital cassette. It's a "you vs. computer" Cribbage, played by the standard rules. The computer shuffles, deals, keeps score and wins... unless you're careful!

143265.name: Dungeon Dice: KickStarter Exclusive Expansion
143265.description:
A set of seven additional dice only made available to those who participated in the game's KickStarter project.

- Three monsters (Harpy, Cockatrice, and Necromancer)
- Three legendary artifacts (Vorpal Sword, Aegis Shield, and Necromancer's Staff)
- One spell (Pain spell)

boardgamehonor: 2013/Spring Parents' Choice Fun Stuff Award Winner
143266.name: Pet Frenzied
143266.description:
Pet Frenzied is played with thirteen pet cards and thirteen matching house cards.

Before the game starts, the pet cards are hidden (facedown) in the play area. Each player that receives a house card and goes in search of the matching pet. When they find it, they take a new house card and go in search of the next pet. This continues until all pets have been found. Whomever has found the most pets at the end of the game wins.

143267.name: Othello III
143267.description:
Publisher Advertisement

A strategy game played on an 8 x 8 board. The object of the game is to capture as many of the squares as possible. You can play against the computer, a friend or have the computer play against itself. Has an interesting graphics display.

143268.name: Touchy Feely
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP Launch Episode 4
143268.description:
Touchy Feely is a game in which players have to find objects using only their sense of touch.

Twenty-six Touchy Feely trinkets (miniatures of real objects) are placed in a nylon container, the "Tube of Touch". Cards showing each object indicate what items should be found.

Three games can be played:

Memory Match: Four cards are drawn. The players get five seconds to memorise them. They are then placed face-down. Now, both players simultaneous go searching for the items shown, and get sixty seconds to retrieve three items and place them on top of the cards. Whomever has the most matches wins the game.
Speedy Feely: One card is drawn. Both players go searching for the object. When someone finds it, he takes the card, and the next card is drawn. Whomever has collected the most cards after sixty seconds wins the game.
Hand Solo: A solo version of Speedy Feely, with one player trying to find as many objects as he can.




A fourth game, Kitchen Sink is played with custom items rather than the supplied trinkets.

143269.name: Chain Letters
143269.description:
Chain Letters is a game similar to Barrel of Monkeys that's played with a number of letter tokens. Each token has hooks that can be used to link them to the other tokens.

The letters are placed in a pile on the table. The players simultaneously attempt to create words by making chains of the letters, without dropping the chain or linking a letter upside down. The pile cannot be shuffled, so the words have to be made using the letters that are visible.

The game continues until no more words can be made; the player who has collected the most letters wins.

143270.name: Dyson's Dodecahedron (Volume 1, Issue 5 - May 2013)
143270.description:
Return to Erdea Manor details Erdea Manor, Levels 3 & 4. It continues on from Issue 4 which detailed Levels 1 & 2 of Erdea Manor.


Erdea Manor is a Labyrinth Lord adventure location for a party of level 3 to 6 characters, expecting an average level of 4.5.

143271.name: 13th Age
rpghonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2013 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
2014 ENnie for Best Game - Nominee
2014 ENnie for Best Rules - Nominee
2014 ENnie for Best Rules - Silver Winner
2014 ENnie for Product of the Year - Nominee
2014 Origins Awards Best Roleplaying Game Nominee
143271.description:
From the back cover:

The World Won't Save Itself

Prophecies fail. Demons invade, living dungeons rip towards the surface, and the Empire's protectors falter. The great icons who shape the world arm for war.

So what's it going to be, heroes? Risk everything to forge your own epic history? Or grab the best loot and escape into the shadows?

13th Age is a d20-rolling fantasy game of battle, treasure, group storytelling, and heroic adventure.

For Players:

Your character's "one unique thing" ensures there's no one else like you.
Alliances and enmities with icons such as the Archmage, Lich King, and Prince of Shadows give your character a place in the world's story, even at first level.
Streamlined and flexible combat rules create fast-moving, free flowing battles.
Character backgrounds let you invent the stories that shape your skills.




As a GM:

Design monsters and adventures quickly.
Surprise yourself and your players with plot hooks from characters' backgrounds and unique features.
Improve any d20-rolling game with mechanics such as the escalation die and incremental advance.




13th Age: Forge heroes. Shape the world. Be legendary.
rpgissuearticle: Midgard Icons: Emperor of the Ghouls

143272.name: Skyward Collapse
143272.description:
How do you balance a war between towns without letting either side obliterate the other? How do you rule over gods, creatures, and men who refuse to obey you? How do you build a thriving landscape of villages against the threat of bandits and mythological powers? Skyward Collapse places you into the role of The Creator, and frees you to tackle these problems your own way. Brought to you by the developer of the modern strategy classic AI War: Fleet Command, Arcen's second full strategy title is equally unique (but far easier to learn): a turn-based 4x strategic god-game.

Your task is to build and populate the floating continent of Luminith. You can create -- but not control -- gods, creatures, and artifacts from both Greek and Norse mythology. The power you wield with these is immense. (As one example, Heimdall's horn causes everyone standing outside to drop dead.) Your task is to keep both factions alive until The Master calls you home -- but this is harder than it sounds. Bandits, along with periodic Woes add to the variety of challenges that you'll face in any given game. Every game plays out completely differently, and you'll need even the craziest of your powers in order to survive what lies in store for you.

Game Features

A turn-based strategic god-game where you control neither faction, but instead strive to maintain the balance of power.
Make towns, trade, diplomacy, and war as the boardgame-like floating continent continues to construct itself around you.
Persuade your minions into doing what you want through incentives as well as controlling what buildings and resources they have access to.
16 gods, each with unique passive abilities and three active powers, help you further your goals as you pass into the Age of Monsters.
Level up your player profile by winning games. Twelve related unlockable buildings in all!
Straightforward controls paired with an intuitive and helpful interface make this an easy title to pick up... but the strategy runs deep.
Multiple difficulty tiers let you play a very relaxed game up to a nail-bitingly difficult one. There's no one best way to win!
Co-op multiplayer planned for 1.0 (but not available from the start of beta).




Source: The Developer Website.

143273.name: Galactic Blockade Runner
143273.description:
Publisher's Catalog

You are the captain of a federation starship battle cruiser. Your mission is to run an enemy blockade and to deliver vital supplies to federation forces under siege on planet M/5. You control your ship's course and speed along with the firing of its weapons. You will have to fight battle after battle successfully to reach your destination. Besides the enemy, you will have to cope with ship malfunctions and ion storms.

This is a sophisticated game providing ship status reports, sensor scans and graphic displays of the enemy ship, weapons tracks and shield hits. It also displays appropriate warnings and messages. You'll find this game faster paced and more challenging than many of the star treks on the market.

143274.name: Sci-Fi Sampler
143274.description:
Publisher Catalog

There are three games in this one program. The first is Star Monster, a hidden monster game. The second is a Lunar Lander simulation, where you can enter the starting values or have the computer do it for you. The third is Space Battle, a space war program where you fight a battle with lasers against an attacking enemy space ship. All of these games include instructions as part of the program along with graphic displays.

143275.name: Demo Program
143275.description:
Publisher Catalog

This is a great program for showing off your computer. It emulates museum compter exhibits. Chatty and personal, it plays several games and gives a math test in addition, subtraction, multiplication and division, with a score when finished. The games it plays are Guess My Number, Craps and Tic-Tac-Toe.

143276.name: TRS-80 Disk Library "C"
143276.description:
User Summary

A compilation of four Leo Christopherson entertainment titles: Android Nim II, Snake Eggs, Lifetwo and Cubes.

Cubes is not a game program - it is a utility that helps solve Instant Insanity, a tabletop block puzzle from Parker Brothers.

143277.name: The House of Seven Gables
143277.description:
Publisher Catalog

Explore and find treasures, they're all yours if you can find them. However, there's a catch! You have to destroy the witch to leave.

143278.name: Journey to the Center of Earth (Text Adventure)
143278.description:
Publisher Catalog

Beware of the earth's hazards as you attempt to gather materials to fix your broken earthdigger.

143279.name: King Tut's Tomb
143279.description:
Publisher Catalog

Beware the evil that lurks within the tomb as you search for Tut's coffin and escape with treasures and your life, if you're lucky!

143280.name: Sorcerer's Castle
143280.description:
Publisher Catalog

Find and enter the sorcerer's castle, gather the treasure, kill the sorcerer, and then try to escape.

143281.name: Adventure Disk "A"
videogamecompilation: Journey to the Center of Earth (Text Adventure)
143281.description:
User Summary

A compilation of four text adventures by Greg Hassett.

143282.name: Magic Miles
143282.description: Game about travel with Auto, Train or Bus. Each player tries to find, while en route, the objects named on the cards he has drawn. Player scoring the most points after all the cards are exhausted is the winner.

143283.name: Cross Country Marathon
143283.description:
The object of the game to see which of the players is first to cover the course from New York to Los Angeles, stopping in each of the cities en route.
The players spin the dial and move their runners as many spaces as is indicated.
The first player to move his runner into Los Angeles wins the race.

143284.name: Railroad game
143284.description: Railroad Game. No. 4661. Object of game is to travel with train from San Francisco to New York. The first player, who reach New York wins the game.

143285.name: War of Nations
143285.description:
Each player places one counter, representing army, on each of his five starting places. Players moves they armies as the dial indicated.
The player wins when he has captured all the opposing armies.

143286.name: Tom & Jerry Run-around
143286.description:
"It's magnetic! Hilarious! Fast and furious fun!"

A two player children's TV tie-in game produced by Berwick in the UK in 1970s.

Game consists of:

- thin raised cardboard board with 4 small pegs in the centre to secure a cardboard chimney piece
- 2 thin cardboard walls, one of them with a chimney attached; the walls have slots in them to denote doors. The chimney has a small slot on one side to denote a mouse hole.
- 2 plastic pegs to secure the walls
- 1 plastic "cap" to the chimney
- 3 plastic doors
- 2 plastic and cardboard sections that move - a fridge and a bookcase
- a cardboard kennel
- a cardboard shelf
- 5 cardboard Jerry "life" cards
- 2 plastic cheese pieces
- 1 plastic sausage piece
- 1 plastic dog bowl
- two plastic rods with magnets attached, the larger one used to control Tom, the smaller to control Jerry
- two plastic and card magnetic playing pieces, one for Tom and one for Jerry
- assembly instructions and rules

Each player has a rod with a magnet on end of it. The rods are slid under the raised game board and used to control the playing pieces. The rod controlling the Tom playing piece attracts the Jerry playing piece as well as the Tom playing piece.
The object of the game is for the player controlling Jerry to get three items of food into the mouse hole whilst avoiding capture by the player controlling Tom. To achieve this they have 5 lives, represented by 5 cards. If the player controlling Jerry places three items of food into the mouse hole before they lose the 5 live cards, they win. If not, then the player controlling Tom wins.

A variant of Balyna Magnetic Super Soccer, for smaller children.

Components were made of thin cardboard and plastic, and were therefore easily ripped/bent/broken. That, combined with the frantic nature of the game, means that complete copies in good condition are extremely hard to find.

143287.name: Shuriken
143287.description:
Shuriken is a board game of ninja combat for 2-5 players. Custom dice, a modular game board, 100 game cards and 250 plastic ninja figures bring fast-paced ninja warfare to the gaming table

Shuriken takes place over the course of ten rounds, each round representing one hour of the night. Each player takes control of a unique ninja Clan and 50 plastic ninja representing unarmed, sword, shuriken, and master ninja. During the game players place, move, and upgrade their ninja forces as they attempt to complete Mission Cards and capture as many enemy ninja as possible.

The game is won by the player with the most victory points at the end of the game. Victory points are earned by capturing enemy ninja, and by completing Mission Cards.

143288.name: Pork Barrel
143288.description:
Publisher Advertisement

THE GAME CONGRESSMEN NEVER STOP PLAYING -- REELECTION

Okay so you've just been elected to Congress. You're young and looking forward to a long and rewarding career. And why shouldn't you be? Everyone loves you, or you wouldn't have been elected in the first place. It should be a snap, right?

The next thing you know, you're seated in the halls of Congress, tossing around billions of dollars like confetti at a ticker tape parade; Department of Defense, 340 billion last year, and looking for 380 billion this year; HEW got 30 billion last year, and say they need 10 billion more. By now. you're beginning to wonder--what about my effect on unemployment? Oh, no!! What about reelection?

Just when you're beginning to think that it might pay to keep a lower profile, (at least until you get the hang of it), the agenda moves into roll call voting. Sure you've got all the figures. You know what percentages of your constituency are blue collar workers, unemployed, elderly, farmers, etc., but the word is out that the President wants you to vote "yea" on this issue, and "nay" on that issue, and you wonder ... "Why is he doing this to me?" And the lobbies! Your district is telling you NO on increased Social Security benefits, but the liberal lobby keeps saying YE$, YE$, YE$, and after all ... what about reelection?

That's the scenario in this superb simulation from the author of Santa Paravia, 'Round the Horn, Troll's Gold. After you and up to 5 other players have finished your term in the hot seat, comes the moment you've been waiting for as you're up for reelection against such celebrities as Jane Fonda and Milton Schapp. How you fare depends entirely on your ability to be all things to all people at all times.

One thing's for sure, your constituency will let you know just how they feel ... are you listening, Richard?

143289.name: 'Round the Horn
143289.description:
Publisher Advertisement

RELIVE THE DAYS OF WOODEN SHIPS AND IRON MEN!

This program simulates three clipper ships setting sail from New York on the same day in a race to San Francisco for prestige and profit. As the captain of one ship, you must find favorable winds and ocean currents allowing you to be the first to reach San Francisco. The passage around Cape Horn is dangerous; many a voyage has ended in tragedy there. Sailing through the doldrums ... well, let's not spoil all the suspense!

143290.name: Slalom (TRS-80)
143290.description:
Back of the Box

COMPETITION SKIING AT YOUR FINGERTIPS!

Excellent use of the INKEY$ function makes for a challenging simulation demanding quick thinking and dexterity.

Choose your course--downhill, slalom or giant slalom. Your angle of descent as you cover the course determines your speed. Gentle traverses across the slope allow more control than gung-ho schussing or hotdogging. Severe injuries (or worse!) will result if you go wild and strike the pilons or trees. Your performance is rated (politely) at the end of your run.

143291.name: Ten Pin Bowling
143291.description:
Publisher Advertisement

America's favorite indoor sport in outstanding simulation! Masterful high speed graphics and scoring just like a regular game. Computer records strikes, spares, splits. Beer frame -- you game?

143292.name: Bridge Challenger
143292.description:
Publisher Advertisement

BRIDGE CHALLENGER is designed for all bridge players from novices to experts who would like to practice and improve their play. Since a standard game of contract bridge requires four players, it is difficult to study the game on your own time under realistic conditions. With BRIDGE CHALLENGER, you and the dummy play as the declaring team against the computer, which plays a skillful defense. The program will deal hands at random according to your specifications for high card points. You can then rotate the hands to play North, South, East or West. At the end of the deal all four hands are displayed, and you can replay your hand now that the cards are known, shuffle only defense-hands, or move on to another deal. The computer keeps track of all four hands and displays them in standard bridge form on the screen. You can stop and examine the previous trick at any point, or review all thirteen tricks at the end of a deal. You can save deals on cassette and reload them for later play. You don't even need a deck of cards to practice your game with BRIDGE CHALLENGER!

143293.name: Foreknowledge
143293.description:
This is a different sort of trick-taking cardgame, playable with a regular deck of cards (part of the deck). Part of the inspiration for the game is the concept of free will vs determinism, and the verses in the Bible texts of Romans 8.

First, the game is for two players only. Second, one player knows what all the cards are that are dealt and decides which hands are to be given to each player, stacks their hand and always leads with their hand. The other player ends up picking trump suit, without fully knowing what all the cards are in (unlike the player who stacked their hand).

Included with the game is a variant that adds bidding, with each player bidding differently.

143294.name: Byzantine Captain's Mistress
143294.description:
This is a game playable on a Byzantine Chessboard (16 round and 4 wide) using Checkers. The game is similar to regular Captain's Mistress (Connect Four), but players control which side of the board pieces enter (and how pieces will follow when entered). In the game, players try to get 4 in a row, vertically, horizontally or diagonally, with a set queuing order for pieces entering a column.

Included is a variant where pieces get recycled, by forming 4 in a row, and winning by preventing their opponent from also doing this.

143295.name: Cluster Luck
143295.description: This is a press your luck game playable on a Byzantine Chessboard. In the game, players try to cluster their pieces into groups to score more points (players score bonus points for their largest group). players roll two dice and move around a lane, leaving a piece behind. If they land on a space they landed on prior, they end up losing all points in the round. Bonus points are awarded for forming larger groups. Players have to decide when to quit, as is typical of a press your luck game, and failure to do so and landing on a space occupied prior results in no points earned for the round. Players have to decide when to either quit or push forward.

143296.name: Omada
143296.description:
This is the game Groups adapted to a Byzantine Chessboard, with 8 pieces aside, instead of 6, as seen in Groups. In this game players attempt to get their pieces on the board connected into a single group of orthogonally (vertically and/or horizontally) connected pieces, after being connected diagonally only. Pieces start out adjacent to one another, and a player's pieces are all connected diagonally at the start of the game.

In the game, pieces move orthgonally, and stop on an empty space, with players alternating moves one piece at a time until one player wins.

Omada is Greek for the word "group".

143297.name: Circle Link
143297.description:
This is a connection game playable on a Byzantine Chessboard. In the game, players try to be the first to connect the inner part of the board to the outer part of the board, by either placing pieces from their reserve off the board, onto an empty space, or by sliding from inside or outside. Players start with 16 pieces off the board, which can end up being recycled and relocated.

A win in the game consists of a player being able to trace a path of spaces occupied with their own pieces vertically or horizontally (not diagonally), linking the inner and outer circle of the board.

143298.name: Lane Ludo
143298.description:
This is a race game playable on a Byzantine Chessboard. Players roll a die and move one of their pieces. Players have a different piece in a different lane and attempt to navigate their pieces home. In the dice version, each player has 4 pieces, one of which fits into each lane (4 of the rows), and each piece faces off against a single enemy piece.

The game also includes a diceless variant where how far pieces move is not governed by a die roll, but the position of the piece in relation to other pieces on the board.

143299.name: Lane Checkers
143299.description:
This game is a game in the Checkers family, playable on a Byzantine Chessboard. In the game players will advance checkers that stay in a lane when moving, and may end up switching lanes when performing a jump capture. A piece may also switch lanes if it promotes to a King piece.

On a Byzantine chess board, it has 4 rows and 16 columns. Pieces stay in the row they are in during place, and only switch rows when jumping. In the game there are 4 pieces per row per player, and players have a total of 24 pieces a side.

143300.name: Lane Backgammon
143300.description:
This is a game in the Backgammon family, playable on a Byzantine Chessboard. The game is similar to regular backgammon, except pieces start out in home area, and are divided up into a number of lanes, rather than all fitting into one lane, as is seen in regular Backgammon.

Player attempt to get all their pieces go around the board and have them land on enemy home spaces to bear off. Players may only do this if they have all their home spaces empty. When hit, pieces go back to their home spaces, rather than off the board on a bar. Players start with 4 pieces per lane (row), and have a total of 16 pieces to start per side.

143301.name: Doom Dome
143301.description:
This is a roll and move game (also playable without the use of dice) on a Byzantine Chessboard. Object of the game is to be the last remaining player. In the game players will in the regular game, move as far as a single six sided die the roll tells them to, trying to avoid barriers put up in the game by players as they move. In the game, as players get eliminated, they end up removing barriers the drop as the move. The game feels a bit light a light cycle race.

Object of the game is to be the last remaining player.

In the diceless variant, player's movement is governed by what other pieces are on the board.

143302.name: Sectorian
143302.description: This is an abstract strategy game playable on a Byzantine Chessboard. In the game, players move their Sectorian spaceships along the intersections of the board, capturing spaces on the board, in order to be able to produce more spaceships. Object of the game is to be the first player to get 8 of their spaceships on the board.

143303.name: ViciGo
143303.description:
ViciGo is a 2 player abstract strategy game playable on a Byzantine chess board.

In the game, players will move their pieces on the board, to either perform a custodial (bookend) capture to remove enemy pieces, or to perform a "bloom" pattern around one of their own pieces, in order to capture spaces on the board.

First player to get a set number of their pieces on the board wins.

143304.name: Arachnid Trap War
143304.description:
This is a 2 player abstract strategy game, playable on a Byzantine Chessboard. In the game, players will move their pieces and try to capture enemy pieces by bookending enemy pieces between their own pieces, so the enemy pieces get frozen so they can't move. A player will then end up moving one unfrozen pieces that is freezing an enemy piece and occupying a space to capture it. A player is also able to leave a piece behind, if the player doesn't move one of their pieces next to an enemy piece (or have that piece moving perform a capture).

The game includes 3 play levels, the first one without a King/Queen/Royal piece, and then a second which adds one Royal piece, and a third variant which has the player have two Royal pieces. Each level of play adds addition win conditions.

The trap and delayed capture are reused from the likes of King's Cross and Linebreakers.

143305.name: Sow and Erode
143305.description:
Board;
The board is four concentric circle with 16 space each (aka a Byzantine Chessboard).

Setup:
The 32 Black and 32 white pieces are alternated like a circular checkerboard.

Rules:
This game is a two player abstract strategy game in the Mancala family. As players sow their pieces, the board position "erodes" and leaves the players fewer and fewer options, and more and more spaces to sow pieces into to be removed from the board.

Object of the game is for a player to capture more of their opponent's pieces than their opponent captured of theirs.

143307.name: Autumn Ash
143307.description:
This is a strategic game of color change for Looney Pyramids that uncommonly incorporates all ten standard Xeno and Rainbow colors. The pyramids are meant to represent a vast array of differently colored autumnal leaves. The goal is to bag "leaves" (aka pyramids) worth twenty points before your opponent does.

The game is either played on a 5X6 board or on a full chess board (in the “Advanced” rules variant).

With each turn, players enter a new piece and move that or another one of their pieces on the board. At the end of their movement phase, the piece moved progresses to a pyramid of the next color in a sequence and is optionally changed to a different sized piece, each of which have a distinct strategic value. Identically colored pieces that are made into rows of three or more are removed from the board and scored.

143308.name: Batter Up!
143308.description:
Publisher Advertisement

It's spring!! Time for stolen bases, fly balls, and sliding into third. Why not let your computer in on the excitement? Your TRS-80 is the pitcher; you and your opponent take turns at bat. Will you hit a grand slam or pop out? Your skill determines the outcome in this action packed game with pleasing graphics. Sorry -- franks and beer not included!

143309.name: Air Raid (TRS-80)
143309.description:
Publisher Advertisement

High speed machine language program with large and small aircraft flying at different altitudes. Ground-based missile launcher aimed and fired from keyboard. Planes explode when hit, sometimes cause damage to nearby aircraft. Score tallied for hits and misses, saved for challenge by another player.

143310.description:
Aliens are invading Earth!
Six alien races are coming to enslave humanity. Which of them will succeed?

The Great Invasion is a control area game with lots of bluffing for 2 to 5 players..

Each player has the control of an alien race in secret, nobody has to know which of them. Every alien has it's own special skills and everybody can use them to their own purposes.

In every turn, a player must choice an alien race, a place to invade and an action token. With that, has to change majorities without give clues to other players about his own race. First, place new invasors. Then, move them to an adjacent place if you want. And last, perform it's special skill.

Note that there is more different aliens in game than players. So you have to pay attention to other player's movements to guess which is their race. And which race is a non-playing one.

At the end of the game, everybody reveals his race and earn points according the majorities.

This are the aliens:

-Proteus: Giant amoebas. Skill -> An invasor comes to the place from an adjacent one, then kill one on main place.
-Enerllaiser: Energy monsters. Skill -> Teleport an alien from the place he is, to the one you want.
-Fetids: they stink. Skill -> Move a invasor to an adjacent place. From that adjacent place, move a different invasor to an adjacent place far away from the original. If at any moment there is no move possible the invasor dies.
-Space Zombies. Like normal zombies, but from outer space. Skill -> Bites an invasor and changes its race to another different.
-Ulfedar: Explote. Skill -> Kills an invasor and another one from an adjacent place.
-Spores. Copycat. Skill -> Copy the skill of another alien on the same place.
143310.name: The Great Invasion

143312.name: Stimmt doch gar nicht!
143312.description:
Educational game where children must carefully listen to the story and find the mistakes in that story grabbing the items or cards from the table. There are 26 items and 26 cards in this game what may included on the stories.

Player who has the most cards/items at the end of the game is the winner.

143313.name: Aventurisches Jahrbuch für das Jahr 1035 BF
143313.description:
from the back of the book

The Aventurian yearbook for the year 1035 BF is a supplementary volume to the series of Regional sourcebooks. The events of the living history of Aventuria are worked into it. In addition, the yearbook contains the first three adventures of the Living-Aventuria Series, in which the players hold the fate of cities, regions and major NPCs in their hands. With Totelichter, Nebelschwaden and 3 adventures are contained that are set in the Warunkei, Havena and Arania.

There are also extensive additions and revisions of the Principality Albernia, the Mark of Rommilys, the Empire of Al'Anfanischen and the Principality of Almada.
The volume end with the description of the religious Rondrian Order of the Holy Blood.
And of course, there is an extensive timeline of the year 1035 BF in the yearbook as well as a first outlook on the year 1036 BF.

Thus, the yearbook contains an exciting mix of masters and players alike and is a handy and user-friendly game help for the living Aventuria.

143314.name: Crisis Mountain
143314.description:
User Summary

Save the west coast from disaster by defusing nuclear bombs in an erupting volcano.

Avoid boulders, bats and lava as you rush thru 2 cavern scenes and 9 skill levels.

143315.name: Safari (TRS-80)
143315.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Manage a motion picture crew on location as you hunt for exotic animals in the game of SAFARI. Can you get your crew through the hazards? Are you good enough and fast enough to capture some good pictures? Will you get there before the other crews? Find out with Safari.

Documentation accompanying program listing in SoftSide Magazine

Each player (or Bwana) is in charge of a safari camp and must organize filming parties including camera crews and bearers, to search the vast 169-region safari country for wild animals. Scoring is accomplished when you successfully film in a region containing an animal. The player with the most film contract points at the end of the game gets the big movie contract and along with that, the usual fame and fortune. When only one person plays the object of the game is to score as many points as possible.

143316.name: The Lair of the Orc Shaman
143316.description:
Publisher Blurb

In the wilds an Orc with great mystical power has drawn to him a retinue of loyal Orc minions and established a stronghold. The Orcs have been carrying out kidnap-raids against the nearby villages and hamlets. The young, old and weak have been carried off to the cave, and never seen again.

Featuring a dungeon map by Matt Jackson, "The Lair of the Orc Shaman" is a micro adventure for 1st Ed gamers, suitable for a party of 5-7 first level adventurers.

Package contains:
The adventure in standard PDF format.
The adventure in PocketMod formatted PDF (Letter and A4), suitable for folding into a tiny booklet to slip in your pocket. This adventure was designed for the PocketMod format.
The adventure in ePUB format, suitable for most eReaders.
The adventure in mobi format, suitable for Kindle readers.
The dungeon map in plain Black and White and in Moleskin-look, with and without room numbers.

143317.name: Amazin' Maze
143317.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Remember trying to reach a rat to run through a maze in psychology class? Amazing Mazes gives you a rodent's-eye viewpoint as you attempt to escape from asinister maze in a race against the clock. Keep Moving ... whenever you stop to catch your breath, the passageways change! Excellent use of high-speed graphics and real-time input make this a fast-paced challenge of skill and dexterity.

143318.name: Sink 'Um!
143318.description:
Publisher Advertisement

"Man the torpedoes...enemy ships approaching...fire!" Sorry, captain, the tubes are being reloaded.

And so it goes, in this action simulation of battleship warfare. Shrewd maneuvers and keen timing are required by the ship's captain, otherwise, who always goes down with the ship?

143319.name: Carribean Admiral
143319.description:
User Summary

You start out as the captain of a small Skiff. Journey the Caribbean, trade with various ports, sink and loot pirate ships, upgrade your own ship to a strong armada of Caravels and, finally, live to defeat the ultra-powerful ghost ship!

143321.name: Civilization Quest
143321.description:
User Summary

A simple point-and-click, civilization-type game in which you start of as a Neanderthal and take steps towards reaching space.

143322.name: The Heroic Dragon Ball Z Adventure Game
143322.description:
Dragon Ball Game edited in English. The objective is to get all 7 dragon balls,travelling a board where there are 10 important locations which have 10 balls of dragon (only 7 are the real) and where events are produced by the cards.

The battles are decided by a bout of throwing balls to a crater where you put a figure to be cut down. The movement is done by obtaining dragon ball points, to be stealing in the game.

An entertaining game for little ones and customizable for more fans.

143323.description:
Simple but fun game based on playing from a hand of cards representing robots. Each has special powers and affects the stack (stak) in different ways, making it more tactical than a simple rock-paper-scissors exercise.

The game functions by giving each player a stack of cards as well as a hand. Each turn, players take a new card from the shared draw pile and may add a face-up card to the stack, trash a card from the stack or from their hand. When a card is played, it will have "entry effect" that may operate on the stack ordering of the player or opponent.

Once all playing/trashing is finished for a turn, the player may attack the card on top of an opponent's stack with the top card of their own. The battle itself is quite simple and just a matter of comparing power, although assuming your bot survives its first battle, it can go on to attack the newly revealed card underneath. The real tactical consideration goes into the pre-attack stack manipulation phase.

There is an open turn structure which allows players to carry out actions in any order and any number of times. This means they can react to the often unpredictable results of long entry effect chains, or to cards that their opponents play defensively during your turn.

The game is also customisable: you can adjust the complexity or game length by adding more Staks for each player or by changing basic game mechanics.
143323.name: Stak Bots
boardgamepodcastepisode: 12. Devon Dice go to UK Games Expo 2016
The Board Room episode two The Counters Board Game Cafe and StakBots

143324.name: Cognosis
143324.description:
Fairly straightforward snakes-and-ladders style game with 600 numerical, verbal and non-verbal reasoning questions (200 of each type) used to determine progress. Designed to help children improve their 11+/CAT scores (Cognitive Ability Tests used in the UK either as part of 11+/school entrance exams/streaming exams within weeks of starting secondary school) but with a "hard-mode" for adults consisting of a 30 second timer for each question rather than the 50 second timer for children. Cognosis Challenge squares add an extra dimension.

Cognosis is an exciting, problem-solving family game. It includes 600 questions based on the 3 question types that are used in Cognitive Ability Tests (CATs)*, tests that are faced by almost all children aged 10 or 11 in the UK.
Children have 50 seconds to answer the questions (the time allowed in a test) but over 12’s only have 30 seconds, making it a game for all the family. Land on a square and answer the question. Get it right and remain where you are or get it wrong and go back to where you came from. Land on a Cognosis Challenge square and challenge one of your opponents to answer a question of your choice – which category do they find the hardest? If they get it wrong, they go back.
Reach the Final Challenge square and answer the question to be crowned the Cognosis Champion.
Cognosis can be played simply as a fun game by all the family but it is also so much more. It gives children valuable practice in answering CAT type questions in the typical time allowed in the tests and so promotes familiarity and builds confidence. The best bit - as it is fun, children want to play it and don’t realise that they are learning and developing with every throw of the dice and every question answered. They also love beating their parents, grandparents or any adult so don’t think this is just a game for the children, they will want you to play too.
Cognosis with a twist
Alternative 1
If you're under 12 and want more of a challenge, why not play the game using the 30 second timer
Alternative 2
Going on a long journey but still want to play/practice, why not take a box of cards (you choose which type) and a timer ( you choose which one) and play simply by pulling out a question, turning over the timer and trying to get the right answer before the timer runs out.
Alternative 3
Out of the house and with a friend. Again, take a box of cards and a timer. One person pulls out a question and lays it flat and the other turns over the timer. Who can get the correct answer first? The first one to correctly answer gets to keep the card. Play for 15 minutes. The winner is the one with the most cards at the end.

143325.name: Gauss Weapons
143325.description:
From the publisher:
Six Guns is a science-fiction roleplaying supplement using the Traveller rules. Each issue presents six items (not always weapons) in detail, with accompanying notes and stat blocks.

Generic versions of most of these items are presented in various game supplements, but there is a significant difference between aiming a generic, vanilla-flavor ‘revolver’ at the opposition and pulling out a specific model chosen as much for what it says about you as for its capabilities. Not all of the equipment herein is ‘better’ than the generic versions. Indeed, some items have significant drawbacks or are tailored to a specific purpose and poor for other applications. However, what they all have in common is being more interesting than the basic rulebook version.

143326.name: Tycoon
143326.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Take the helm of a small manufacturing business - set pay standards, advertising budgets, etc. Your progress is well-charted.

This game can accommodate up to four would-be financial wizards... last one to make $10,000,000 becomes the janitor!

143327.name: Rescue Organizations
143327.description:
From the publisher:
Six Guns is a science-fiction roleplaying supplement using the Traveller rules from Mongoose Publishing. Each issue presents six examples of the topic at hand in detail, with accompanying notes and stat blocks.
This issue’s topic is not a type of equipment, but a set of organizations that provide emergency relief and disaster response. While specific names have been associated with these companies and agencies in the body of the descriptions, and some flavor details provided are specific to the Twilight Sector Setting, all of the following should prove suitably flexible to insert into any Traveller game, regardless of setting.

Note that all features, rules and special effects contained in this supplement are subject to the approval of whoever runs your game. There’s nothing game-breaking in here, but neither is it carved in stone that these items must exist in your game universe. And remember… if you’re allowed to use it, then the opposition can use it too.

143328.name: Atlantic Balloon Crossing
143328.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Rise far above the surface

Become part of the wind!

From Presque Isle, Maine to Paris, France, you must control your flight by varying height according to your knowledge of weather conditions, wind speeds and directions at various altitudes. Regulation of gas volume and
ballast will cause the balloon to ascend or descend. Radio contacts, if and when you can make them, occasionally give your position over the Atlantic. You can see storm clouds closing in and your horizon in the distance. If you stay out of the drink and land successfully nearest Paris, you win! One to three players.

143329.name: Lasers
143329.description:
From the publisher:
Six Guns Lasers is a sourcebook on Laser weapons specifically for the Mongoose Traveller rules but easily convertible to most science fiction RPG rules.

The strength of the line lies in the descriptions of the products, both their benefits and weaknesses and also the flavor of the items. From the manufacturers to the weapons themselves nothing about a Rourke Weapons Systems Light Cobra Laser Revolver will feel generic.

Contains the original adventure scenario "Gun Runner".

143330.name: Totemo
143330.description:
Unloose the spirit. Break the spell.

TOTEMO is a game designed to soothe your mind and train your brain.

Uncover the mystery hidden between the realms in a unique puzzle game. Travel to enchanted places of the past with your witch doctor guide and solve over 100 logic tasks.

Play at your own pace. Think hard and weight carefully your next move, or just stroke your moves intuitively and let the solution emerge in front of your eyes.

Play the survival mode for extra challenge, make your stand against the time and write your name into the on-line leaderboards.

Source: The Game Website.

143331.name: Nine Games for Pre-School Children
143331.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Until they go to school, children think that learning is fun, not work. Is this the reason that they learn so much faster in the early years? Play is natural learning. And learning is great play. With these games children teach each other the alphabet, addition and subtraction, recognition of letters and words, even art as they play with patterns on the screen. The games are written for ages four to six. The author has a degree in education, with graduate study in child development and counseling, plus a wide variety of teaching experience in industry, the military, public and private schools, and churches. If you have children, and you also have a TRS-80, then you should have Nine Games for Pre-School Children. All nine games and the menu are in the computer at one time, and the children will quickly learn to select the one they want.

143332.name: Jabberwocky
143332.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Jabberwocky was to be based on Lewis Carroll's poem of the same name with designs by Todd Harris. It would have followed a young wizard and his monster friend.

143335.name: All Star Baseball
143335.description:
Documentation accompanying program listing in SoftSide Magazine

Why settle for watching baseball on television when you can play it! With this game, you can make the team, but winning may be another matter. A game for two players.

You set the strategy for pitching and hitting, and you have to move your player across the screen to do the fielding, but there is nothing cut and dried in this version of baseball. The catcher may miss a tag on a squeeze play at home, the shortstop commit an error on an easy double play ball, or you could even be ahead in the ninth by several runs, have two outs with no one on base, and still blow it!

143336.name: Pentominoes
143336.description:
Publisher Advertisement

While dominoes are made by joining two squares together, pentominoes are made by joining five squares. There are twelve, each named after the letter it resembles. To win you must fit them together to form a larger, 60-square shape, such as a 6 x 10 rectangle -- something like a jigsaw puzzle. Unlike jigsaw pieces, however, pentominoes can be flipped over as well as rotated. When you see that you have fallen into error you may remove pieces at will and try them elsewhere. Sounds easy? Sure is is -- up until the last couple of pieces! An endless fascination for the dedicated puzzler. Top-notch graphics and sound effects.

143337.name: Barricade (TRS-80)
143337.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Break through the 5-wall barricade with the high-speed ball and keyboard controlled paddle! Trap the ball among the walls and watch it destroy the 100 blocks! Select from 8 speeds, 4 paddle sizes, and 3 ball-angle limits to challenge experts and beginners. Three scores with the best of each saved to be challenged by other players. Nobody can achieve the maximum weighted score of 33,000!

143338.name: Duplicity
143338.description:
from the back of the book

Space, the final frontier
These are the voyages of the Starship Enterprise, on its five year mission to seek out new life and new civilizations; to boldly go where no man has gone before.
Ooooooooooooeeeeeeeee wah wah wah wah...
After negotiations for precious minerals with the Halkans fall through, a strange malfunction in the transporter room has caused a rift between the dimensions, switching Federation crew members with their alternate, Imperial selves. Now, with time running out, can the crew manage to survive the deadly treachery of the Empire long enough to get themselves back home, and maybe get some short-skirted, mid-riffed booty to boot?

143339.name: Treasure Dungeon 2
143339.description:
Documentation accompanying program listing in SoftSide Magazine

You will be exploring a dungeon of rooms and passages. In this dungeon you will find a variety of monsters. Defeat the monsters, and you will usually gain treasure. But if you are weakened, you may be killed.

The screen will display the section of the dungeon you are in as viewed from above. You are represented by a small figure in the center of the room. The boundaries of the room represent the type of walls around you. A solid line means a solid wall (or perhaps a secret door), a solid line with a 'D' means a dosed door, an 'O' means an open door. A gap in a line means an open passage, and no line at all means that you can see no wall in that direction.

If you find a monster, the display will show a huge monstrous figure in the center of the room. You may run or fight. If you fight, you both exchange blows until one is defeated or you retreat. If you keep on fighting against a strong monster, you may be killed. If you run away, the monster may strike a parting blow and you may drop some treasure. If you defeat the monster, you will then gain its treasure if one exists. It is always a good idea to check your strength after a fight to see if you need rest.

When you find and defeat all the monsters, the game is over. You may then rate yourself on how long it has taken you. For the first adventure, anything less than 100 hours in dungeon time is pretty good. If you wish to quit before all the monsters are defeated, you may do so by going back to the entrance and pressing 'Q', you will then be asked if you want to quit or not.

User Summary

In addition to getting the program listing published in the September 1979 issue of SoftSide magazine, creator David E. White also offered Treasure Dungeon 2 for direct sale. His ads for the game appeared in the classifieds section of Dragon magazine in February and March of 1980.

143340.name: Fastgammon
143340.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Backgammon is a two-person game.

In FASTGAMMON the computer is one player (its men are O's) and you are the other (your men are X's).

Whether you are a beginner or an experienced backgammon player, FASTGAMMON can help you improve your game. First of all, you now have an opponent that is always ready and willing to play. There is no substitute for experience -- the more games you play the more you learn about backgammon. But there is another unique method by which FASTGAMMON can help you improve your game.

By selecting "2" when the starting message is displayed, the same sequence of rolls that occurred in the game just
played (the last game for which you selected "1") will occur again.

HOW GOOD IS FASTGAMMON?

We make no claims that FASTGAMMON plays at an expert level. In fact, good players will notice obvious mistakes that the computer makes from time to time. The game of backgammon has many subtleties, and the algorithm programmed into version 1 of FASTGAMMON is a fairly simple one. There is an advantage that the computer has, however, over human players -- the computer never forgets what it "knows". Due to oversights, distractions, or haste, human players often forget what they know. This fact is the edge that makes FASTGAMMON competitive against good players.

143341.name: Kriegspiel
143341.description:
Publisher Advertisement

ATTENTION ALL WAR GAMERS

The war games you have come to love have come to the TRS-80!

River
Hexagonal Grid
Terrain Obstacles
Armor, Infantry, and Engineers
Computer determined combat results

This Two Player game is an elementary war game (Kriegspiel is German for "war game") giving a battle between two countries located in opposite corners of the screen. The object is to capture the enemy capital. During play. each piece flashes in turn, displaying the number of moves left. You can move it, wait until you have moved other pieces, skip it, or even go directly to combat after moving only some of your pieces. You must stop and do battle whenever you are adjacent to an enemy piece. In battle, you can be eliminated, the other player can be eliminated, an exchange can take place, or a retreat may be required. You do the brainwork, General; the computer carries out your orders. Strategy and fate determine the battle!

143342.name: Kriegspiel II
143342.description:
Publisher Advertisement

A Wargamer's delight! Throw away your pencils, charts* and dice. Let the computer do the dirty work while you concentrate on strategy. Kriegspiel II is a much improved, two-player version of the original--with machine language routines for extra speed.

Select one of 9,999 scenarios including towns, tanks and terrain. Choose the number of mountains (up to 200), then sit back and watch as the computer generates your 31 x 32 game board, sets up the pieces, the towns, the mountains and a river.

Even the weather will become an important factor as play proceeds. To win, you must enter the Capitol City of your opponent (or reduce his fighting strength below half of your own).

* Combat Resolution Tables, Basic Turn Allowances, Terrain Effects Charts, etc.

143343.name: Reise um die Welt
143343.description:
Objective: be the first turning back to Europe (40)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a red marked space follow instructions glued into lid;
remarks:
should have been published ~1920's

143344.name: Die Reise nach der Sonne
143344.description:
Objective: be the first reaching the top (sun)
- moving by turns -
each player rolls two colored dice choosing one of the shown colors to move along. Throwing the same colors player may choose this color or roll again.
remarks:
due to design game should have been produced during 1950's or earlier.

143345.name: Wir jagen mit der Kamera
143345.description:
Objective: gain as many winning points as possible taking photographs from wild animals.
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a 'pictured' space you may collect appropiate card be the first one, otherwise collect winning points only. Some spaces send you back or forwards...
remarks:
game - as usual for GDR products - praises socialist countries..

143347.name: Civilization Central America
143347.description:
Civilization Central America is a variant of Advanced Civilization. Players build cities, collect and trade commodities, and buy technologies, dealing with many recurring calamities along the way.

Set in Central America, the map includes the same number of territories, population density, and city sites as Advanced Civilization with the Western Extension Map. There are 3 commodities each in 9 trade card decks, for a total of 27 commodities. There are eight minor tradable calamities, eight tradable calamities, and eight non-tradable calamities. All commodities and most calamities are new. Players may purchase sixty-three new and revised technologies from the Dawn of History rules, with a unique point system used to progress on the Chronological Advancement Chart.

The game comes with all parts required for play except the rules, which may be downloaded from the publisher website and The General (Avalon Hill magazine) archives. Players need not own Civilization or Advanced Civilization.

143348.description:
The Dynamite Promo is an additional card that can be added to the Saloon Deck.

It is a special weapon that allows a player to make an attack with dynamite, choosing a cover rather than a player. Dynamite deals damage to every player in that cover and each player in reach of that cover. Affected players may block with either gun or melee blocks.

Dynamite cannot be affected by attack enhancement cards, cover bonuses, or cover defense. Dynamite is dropped when used.

Dynamite is not used in a team game.
143348.name: High Noon Saloon: Dynamite Promo

143351.description:
An additional set of cones for Can't Stop, compatible with the 2011 Gryphon Games version of Can't Stop.

The cones can be used to add an extra player to the game, or otherwise just used to play with your favorite color!
143351.name: Can't Stop: Cones

143352.name: Hydra
143352.description:
Hydra is a game for two players to test their mental ability and logical thinking against each other. With a look and feel of game that could have been played by men of the Norse whilst they drank and feasted in their Mead halls or even taken on the raiding trips and played at sea. Hydra is a completely new game of intelligence and cunning, you must create an unbroken line of tiles from one side of the board to the other whilst stopping your opponent from doing the same. The first person to do so wins the game.

A unique feature of Hydra is that it is played East to West and North to South or it could be West to East and South to North. The game gets its name from the style of play of creating lines that get broken like they have been cut and then you must start a new one, just like when Hercules cut off one head of the Hydra another new one or two grow back. The game mechanics are very simple with only three different types of tiles and a single hand count of rules to beat your opponent.

Game play can take just a couple of minutes when you first learn to play, up to tens of minutes or more as you and your opponents learn the subtle flow of cunning tactics that are wrapped in Hydra.

143353.name: Alien Invasion (TRS-80)
143353.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Now you can continue to play this popular arcade game even after you run out of quarters. Shoot down the invading aliens, but protect your guns from their bombs. Great sound and graphics!

143354.name: Cavern Creatures
143354.description:
The player controls a small craft, navigating it through a series of winding caverns and tunnels while shooting or avoiding obstacles. The caverns scroll from the bottom of the screen to the top at a fixed speed, so the player must always move forward.
The obstacles filling the tunnels are mostly the eponymous "creatures" and appear as simple icons like smiley faces, floppy diskettes, birds, eyes, apples, bunches of grapes, Pac Man ghosts, baseball hats, turrets, etc. Many of these objects are animated, but they do not actually move about. The player's craft fires bolts of energy simultaneously in three directions (left, right and forward) that destroy the creatures but consume the ship's energy, tracked by a green bar at the bottom of the screen. Energy is replenished by shooting occasional "tanks" on the tunnel walls.

Special objects in the caverns include indestructible Rubiks cube-like boxes that can be shot to gain extra points, indestructible wriggling snakes (one of the cavern's few mobile opponents), and pulsing energy barriers.

The craft is destroyed if it strikes any object or the cavern wall; a new one can be put back into play at any position on the screen. The game ends when the last craft is destroyed or when the player beats the final challenge. The game's introduction promises that "the end battle will be a surprise that no one can miss.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cavern Creatures", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

143355.name: Imperio
143355.description:
The game combined the "capture the leader" and geometric movement aspects of games like Chess, Xiangqi or Shogi with custodial capture such as is found in games like Petteia or Hnefatafl. Because capture then involves a combination of two pieces, control of the board is consciously distinguished from simply the ability to move to any given space. Hence, it resembles Chess up to a point but players have to think about relative positioning of their own pieces in combination and of the opponent's pieces to see what areas of the board they control.

Imperio is the Latin word which refers to having complete control over someone, to the power of life and death in principle. This game is about control of the board, which entails the power of life and death (so to speak) over the opponent's pieces. One has to think differently from most games average people today would know to achieve that type of control effectively.

143356.description:
Tom Vasel Dice Tower 2013 Kickstarter funding campaign promo character for Pixel Tactics

The Game Reviewer/ Tom Vasel brings dice to Pixel Tactics. Depending how the card is played, the card has the ability to add 1d6 to attacks, give 2 extra actions or reduce a heroe's life to the difference between 2d6. Played as the starting hero (Tom Vasel) there is a chance to rout opposing units.

Finally played as a single time effect, it lets you challenge your opponent to another 2-player game, allowing the winner to destroy three heroes of his choice.
143356.name: Pixel Tactics: Game Reviewer/Tom Vasel

143357.name: Tower of Fear
143357.description:
Back of Box

Deep in the Graylock outback, in the mists of pre-time, dwelt THE WIZARDS, a race not native to this simple place, a race of powerful necromancers, whose awesome prowess at magic caused rampant terror in every heart that dared contemplate them.

As the years marched by, they each individually succumbed to the ravages of death. Some, who were the most powerful among their peers, forstalled the shadow-journey by barring themselves from the sunlight and the eyes of time, in huge towers, islands of life in the barren desert. By surrounding themselves with magic, they, for a time, held off death. But the reaper claims all, so he claimed each of The Wizards in his turn.

The last of these would-be immortals, BLACKHEART FIRETHROWER, so named through profeciency with flameballs, built a fortress so awesome as to earn a reputation of Widowmaker to the Kings. Many tried to conquer it, to dispell the dred CYCLOPS, to penetrate its inky interior and remove its secrets and treasure. None returned. Kings and paupers all perished in its traps and corridors.

So the Wizard's Tower, last of the surviving fortresses, and catacomb to the omnipresent undead spirit of BLACKHEART FLAMETRHOWER became known as THE TOWER OF FEAR.

ENTER IF YOU DARE, BUT DON'T EXPECT TO EMERGE ALIVE.

143358.description:
10 Mage Wars promo cards made available through the 2013 Dice Tower funding campaign on Kickstarter:

The enchantment Akiro's Favor that lets you re-roll dice
Ballista, a war machine that shoots piercing bolts.
The tough Bloodcrag Minotaur.
Critical Strike to cause piercing attacks.
The mysterious Gravicor that prevents flying.
Hurl Meteorite a massive damage spell.
Lion Savagery another enchantment to cause piercing attacks.
The unavoidable Morning Star.
The Temple High Guard that can counterstrike even before the attack.
And the piercing Vorpal Blade.
143358.name: Mage Wars: Dice Tower 2013 funding campaign promo card set

143359.description: Up to four adventurers will race to unlock the secrets of an ancient tomb. Players take turns rolling and moving up to the number of spaces rolled attempting to be the first to return all of their keys to gain access to the treasures within, but beware! The spaces can cause the tomb tiles to flip, swap, or rotate. Be the first to claim the Pharaoh’s priceless treasures to win.
143359.name: EJiPT
